Ambassadors be send to Carthage, among them be Marcus Porcius Cato, who after see that Carthage could make a comeback and regain its importance, end all his speeches, no matter what the subject be, by say: `` Ceterum censeo Carthaginem esse delendam''( `` Furthermore, I think that Carthage must be destroy'').

Babylonian mathematics be write use a sexagesimal( base-60) numeral system.[ 20] From this derive the modern day usage of 60 seconds in a minute, 60 minutes in an hour, and 360( 60 x 6) degrees in a circle, as well as the use of seconds and minutes of arc to denote fractions of a degree. It be likely the sexagesimal system be choose because 60 can be evenly divide by 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 10, 12, 15, 20 and 30.[ 20] Also, unlike the Egyptians, Greeks, and Romans, the Babylonians have a true place-value system, where digits write in the left column represent larger values, much as in the decimal system.[ 19] The power of the Babylonian notational system lay in that it could be use to represent fractions as easily as whole numbers; thus multiply two numbers that contain fractions be no different than multiply integers, similar to our modern notation.[ 19] The notational system of the Babylonians be the best of any civilization until the Renaissance,[ 23] and its power allow it to achieve remarkable computation accuracy and power; for example, the Babylonian tablet YBC 7289 give an approximation of √2 accurate to five decimal places.[ 23] The Babylonians lack, however, an equivalent of the decimal point, and so the place value of a symbol often have to be infer from the context.[ 19] By the Seleucid period, the Babylonians have develop a zero symbol as a placeholder for empty positions; however it be only use for intermediate positions.[ 19] This zero sign do not appear in terminal positions, thus the Babylonians come close but do not develop a true place value system.[ 19]
During the reign of the last Mughals and Nawabs of Oudh dance fell down to the status of 'nautch', an unethical sensuous thing of courtesans.

In the last two thousand years, there may have been contact by Polynesians who sailed to and from the continent across the South Pacific Ocean. The sweet potato, which originated in South America, spread through some areas of the Pacific. There is no genetic legacy of human contact.[9]

The late 1950s to the early 1970s was a period of intense research and institutional expansion for molecular biology, which had only recently become a somewhat coherent discipline. In what organismic biologist E. O. Wilson called "The Molecular Wars", the methods and practitioners of molecular biology spread rapidly, often coming to dominate departments and even entire disciplines.[75] Molecularization was particularly important in genetics, immunology, embryology, and neurobiology, while the idea that life is controlled by a "genetic program"—a metaphor Jacob and Monod introduced from the emerging fields of cybernetics and computer science—became an influential perspective throughout biology.[76] Immunology in particular became linked with molecular biology, with innovation flowing both ways: the clonal selection theory developed by Niels Jerne and Frank Macfarlane Burnet in the mid-1950s helped shed light on the general mechanisms of protein synthesis.[77]

The war begin with the audacious invasion of Hispania by Hannibal, the Carthaginian general who have lead operations on Sicily in the First Punic War. Hannibal, son of Hamilcar Barca, rapidly march through Hispania to the Italian Alps, cause panic among Rome's Italian allies. The best way find to defeat Hannibal's purpose of cause the Italians to abandon Rome be to delay the Carthaginians with a guerrilla war of attrition, a strategy propound by Quintus Fabius Maximus, who would be nickname Cunctator( `` delayer'' in Latin), and whose strategy would be forever after know as Fabian. Due to this, Hannibal's goal be unachieved: he could not bring enough Italian cities to revolt against Rome and replenish his diminish army, and he thus lack the machines and manpower to besiege Rome.

In China, the Qing Dynasty be overthrow follow the Xinhai Revolution. The Xinhai Revolution begin with the Wuchang Uprising on October 10, 1911 and end with the abdication of Emperor Puyi on February 12, 1912. The primary parties to the conflict be the Imperial forces of the Qing Dynasty( 1644–1911), and the revolutionary forces of the Chinese Revolutionary Alliance( Tongmenghui).

The first developments for store data be initially base on photographs, start with microphotography in 1851 and then microform in the 1920s, with the ability to store documents on film, make them much more compact. In the 1970s, electronic paper allow digital information appear as paper documents.

The industrialisation of the watch industry started 1854 also in Waltham, Massachusetts, at the Waltham Watch Company, with the development of machine tools, gauges and assembling methods adapted to the micro precision required for watches.

The ancient Egyptians view men and women, include people from all social classes except slaves, as essentially equal under the law, and even the lowliest peasant be entitle to petition the vizier and his court for redress.[ 97] Although, slaves be mostly use as indentured servants. They be able to buy and sell, or work their way to freedom or nobility, and usually be treat by doctors in the workplace.[ 98] Both men and women have the right to own and sell property, make contracts, marry and divorce, receive inheritance, and pursue legal disputes in court. Married couples could own property jointly and protect themselves from divorce by agree to marriage contracts, which stipulate the financial obligations of the husband to his wife and children should the marriage end. Compared with their counterparts in ancient Greece, Rome, and even more modern places around the world, ancient Egyptian women have a greater range of personal choices and opportunities for achievement. Women such as Hatshepsut and Cleopatra VII even become pharaohs, while others wield power as Divine Wives of Amun. Despite these freedoms, ancient Egyptian women do not often take part in official roles in the administration, serve only secondary roles in the temples, and be not as likely to be as educate as men.[ 97]

The Edwin Smith papyrus be one of the first medical documents still extant, and perhaps the earliest document that attempt to describe and analyse the brain: it might be see as the very beginnings of modern neuroscience. However, while Egyptian medicine have some effective practices, it be not without its ineffective and sometimes harmful practices. Medical historians believe that ancient Egyptian pharmacology, for example, be largely ineffective.[ 7] Nevertheless, it apply the following components: examination, diagnosis, treatment and prognosis, to the treatment of disease,[ 2] which display strong parallels to the basic empirical method of science and accord to G. E. R. Lloyd[ 8] play a significant role in the development of this methodology. The Ebers papyrus( c. 1550 BC) also contain evidence of traditional empiricism.

Although the exact species authoring the tools remains unknown, Mode 1 tools in Africa were manufactured and used predominantly by Homo habilis. They cannot be said to have developed these tools or to have contributed the tradition to technology. They continued a tradition of yet unknown origin. As chimpanzees sometimes naturally use percussion to extract or prepare food in the wild, and may use either unmodified stones or stones that they have split, creating an Oldowan tool, the tradition may well be far older than its current record.[citation needed]

When the Ottoman Empire be defeat by an Arab uprising and British Empire forces after the Sinai and Palestine Campaign in 1918, the Arab population be reward with what many Islamic activists of more recent times have describe as an Anglo-French betrayal. British and French governments conclude a secret treaty( the Sykes–Picot Agreement) to partition the Middle East between them and, additionally, the British, via the Balfour Declaration promise the international Zionist movement their support in re-create the historic Jewish homeland in Palestine.

The years of the First World War be a complex transitional period for the film industry. The exhibition of films change from short one-reel programmes to feature films. Exhibition venues become larger and begin charge higher prices.

Urbanization increased as the population grew and as the division of labor grew more complex. Large urban centers, such as Nanjing and Beijing, also contributed to the growth of private industry. In particular, small-scale industries grew up, often specializing in paper, silk, cotton, and porcelain goods. For the most part, however, relatively small urban centers with markets proliferated around the country. Town markets mainly traded food, with some necessary manufactures such as pins or oil.

The domestic dwellings of elite and ordinary Egyptians alike be construct from perishable materials such as mud bricks and wood, and have not survive. Peasants live in simple homes, while the palaces of the elite and the pharaoh be more elaborate structures. A few survive New Kingdom palaces, such as those in Malkata and Amarna, show richly decorate walls and floors with scenes of people, birds, water pools, deities and geometric designs.[ 154] Important structures such as temples and tombs that be intend to last forever be construct of stone instead of mud bricks. The architectural elements use in the world's first large-scale stone building, Djoser's mortuary complex, include post and lintel supports in the papyrus and lotus motif.

Ancient China be home to several compete schools of political thought, most of which arise in the Spring and Autumn period. These include Mohism( a utilitarian philosophy), Taoism, Legalism( a school of thought base on the supremacy of the state), and Confucianism. Eventually, a modified form of Confucianism( heavily infuse with elements of Legalism) become the dominant political philosophy in China during the Imperial Period. This form of Confucianism also deeply influenced and be expound upon by scholars in Korea and Japan.

Charles S. Peirce be also a pioneer in statistics. Peirce hold that science achieve statistical probabilities, not certainties, and that chance, a veer from law, be very real. He assign probability to an argument’s conclusion rather than to a proposition, event, etc., as such. Most of his statistical writings promote the frequency interpretation of probability( objective ratios of cases), and many of his writings express skepticism about( and criticize the use of) probability when such models be not base on objective randomization.[ 92] Though Peirce be largely a frequentist, his possible world semantics introduce the `` propensity'' theory of probability. Peirce( sometimes with Jastrow) investigate the probability judgments of experimental subjects, pioneer decision analysis.

Until the early 1970s, the Republic of China was recognized as the sole legitimate government of China by the United Nations and most Western nations, refusing to recognize the People's Republic of China on account of the Cold War. However in 1971, Resolution 2758 was passed by the UN General Assembly and "the representatives of Chiang Kai-shek" (and thus the ROC) were expelled from the UN and replaced as "China" by the PRC. In 1979, the United States switched recognition from Taipei to Beijing. The KMT ruled Taiwan under martial law until the late 1980s, with the stated goal of being vigilant against Communist infiltration and preparing to retake mainland China. Therefore, political dissent was not tolerated.

For the duration of the 6th century, the Eastern Roman Empire was embroiled in a series of deadly conflicts, first with the Persian Sassanid Empire (see Roman–Persian Wars), followed by the onslaught of the arising Islamic Caliphate (Rashidun and Umayyad). By 650, the provinces of Egypt, Palestine and Syria were lost to the Muslim forces, followed by Hispania and southern Italy in the 7th and 8th centuries (see Muslim conquests). The Arab invasion from the east was stopped after the intervention of the Bulgarian Empire (see Tervel of Bulgaria).

Education in New Zealand began with provision made by the provincial government, the missionary Christian churches and private education. The first act of parliament for education was passed in 1877, and sought to establish a standard for primary education. It was compulsory for children to attend school until the age of 14 years.

Most of what be know of the ancient world come from the accounts of antiquity's own historians. Although it be important to take into account the bias of each ancient author, their accounts be the basis for our understanding of the ancient past. Some of the more notable ancient writers include Herodotus, Thucydides, Arrian, Plutarch, Polybius, Sima Qian, Sallust, Livy, Josephus, Suetonius, and Tacitus.
The Pacific front saw major action during the Second World War, mainly between the belligerents Japan and the United States.

The first ruler in the Mediterranean know to have officially set standards of weight and money be Pheidon.[ 67] Minting occur in the latter parts of the 7th century amongst the cities of Grecian Asia Minor, spread to Aegean parts of the Greek islands and the south of Italy by 500 BC.[ 26] The first stamp money( have the mark of some authority in the form of a picture or words) can be see in the Bibliothèque Nationale of Paris. It be an electrum stater of a turtle coin, coin at Aegina island. This coin[ 68] dates about 700 BC.[ 69]
More than 2,000 bushrangers are believed to have roamed the Australian countryside, beginning with the convict bolters and ending after Ned Kelly's last stand at Glenrowan.[199]

Over the next half-century, all areas previously under the Ming dynasty be consolidate under the Qing. Xinjiang, Tibet, and Mongolia be also formally incorporate into Chinese territory. Between 1673 and 1681, the Kangxi Emperor suppress the Revolt of the Three Feudatories, an uprising of three generals in Southern China who have be deny hereditary rule of large fiefdoms grant by the previous emperor. In 1683, the Qing stag an amphibious assault on southern Taiwan, bring down the rebel Kingdom of Tungning, which be found by the Ming loyalist Koxinga( Zheng Chenggong) in 1662 after the fall of the Southern Ming, and have serve as a base for continued Ming resistance in Southern China. The Qing defeat the Russians at Albazin, result in the Treaty of Nerchinsk.

In the 9th century, Bimaristan medical schools be form in the medieval Islamic world, where medical diplomas be issue to students of Islamic medicine who be qualify to be a practicing Doctor of Medicine.[ 51] Al-Azhar University, found in Cairo, Egypt in 975, be a Jami'ah( `` university'' in Arabic) which offer a variety of post-graduate degrees, have a Madrasah and theological seminary, and taught Islamic law, Islamic jurisprudence, Arabic grammar, Islamic astronomy, early Islamic philosophy and logic in Islamic philosophy.[ 51]

His successor, Tanutamun, also make a failed attempt to regain Egypt for Nubia. He successfully defeat Necho, the native Egyptian puppet ruler instal by Ashurbanipal, take Thebes in the process. The Assyrians then send a large army southwards. Tantamani( Tanutamun) be heavily rout and flee back to Nubia. The Assyrian army sack Thebes to such an extent it never truly recovered. A native ruler, Psammetichus I be place on the throne, as a vassal of Ashurbanipal, and the Nubians be never again to pose a threat to either Assyria or Egypt.[ 74]

Empiricism be one of several compete views that predominate in the study of human knowledge, know as epistemology. Empiricism emphasize the role of experience and evidence, especially sensory perception, in the formation of ideas, over the notion of innate ideas or tradition[ 2] in contrast to, for example, rationalism which rely upon reason and can incorporate innate knowledge.

International cooperation in sociology begin in 1893 when René Worms( 1869–1926) found the small Institut International de Sociologie, eclipse by much larger International Sociological Association from 1949. In 1905 the American Sociological Association, the world's largest association of professional sociologists, be found, and Lester F. Ward be select to serve as the first President of the new society.

One response was the Keynesian Resurgence. This emerged as a consensus among some policy makers and economists for a Keynesian solutions. As contrasted sharply with the previous economic orthodoxy in its support for government intervention in the economy. Figures in this school included Dominique Strauss-Kahn, Olivier Blanchard, Gordon Brown, Paul Krugman, and Martin Wolf.[116][117][118]

However, it be his successor at the Lyceum, the philosopher Theophrastus, who make the greatest progress in antiquity in his work On Stones. He describe many minerals and ores both from local mines such as those at Laurium near Athens, and further afield. He also quite naturally discussed types of marble and building materials like limestones, and attempt a primitive classification of the properties of minerals by their properties such as hardness.

After the downfall of the prior Gupta Empire in the middle of the 6th century, North India revert to smaller republics and monarchical states. The power vacuum result in the rise of the Vardhanas of Thanesar, who begin unite the republics and monarchies from the Punjab to central India. After the death of Harsha's father and brother, representatives of the empire crown Harsha emperor at an assembly in April 606 CE, give him the title of Maharaja when he be merely 16 years old.[ 193] At the height of his power, his Empire cover much of North and Northwestern India, extend East till Kamarupa, and South until Narmada River; and eventually make Kannauj( in present Uttar Pradesh state) his capital, and rule till 647 CE.[ 194]
Canada during this era be dominate by the leadership of Pierre Elliot Trudeau. Eventually in 1982 at the end of his tenure, Canada receive a new constitution.

The empire's legacy include many monuments spread over South India, the best known of which be the group at Hampi. The previous temple building traditions in South India come together in the Vijayanagara Architecture style. The mingling of all faiths and vernaculars inspire architectural innovation of Hindu temple construction, first in the Deccan and later in the Dravidian idioms use the local granite. South Indian mathematics flourish under the protection of the Vijayanagara Empire in Kerala. The south Indian mathematician Madhava of Sangamagrama found the famous Kerala school of astronomy and mathematics in the 14th century which produce a lot of great south Indian mathematicians like Parameshvara, Nilakantha Somayaji and Jyeṣṭhadeva in medieval south India.[ 295] Efficient administration and vigorous overseas trade bring new technologies such as water management systems for irrigation.[ 296] The empire's patronage enable fine arts and literature to reach new heights in Kannada, Telugu, Tamil and Sanskrit, while Carnatic music evolve into its current form.[ 297]
As soon as intercontinental missiles were developed, military planners began programmes and strategies to counter their effectiveness.

The history of musical development in Iran( Persian music) date back to the prehistoric era. The great legendary king, Jamshid, be credit with the invention of music. Music in Iran can be trace back to the days of the Elamite Empire( 2500-644 BC). Fragmentary documents from various periods of the country's history establish that the ancient Persians possess an elaborate musical culture. The Sassanid period( AD 226-651), in particular, have leave us ample evidence point to the existence of a lively musical life in Persia. The names of some important musicians such as Barbod, Nakissa and Ramtin, and titles of some of their works have survive.

The Thera eruption occurred around the Aegean Collapse, 110 km (68 mi) north of Crete. Speculation include a tsunami from Thera (more commonly known today as Santorini) destroyed Cretan cities. A tsunami may have destroyed the Cretan navy in its home harbour, which then lost crucial naval battles; so that in the LMIB/LMII event (c. 1450 BC) the cities of Crete burned and the Mycenaean civilization took over Knossos. If the eruption occurred in the late 17th century BC (as most chronologists now think) then its immediate effects belong to the Middle to Late Bronze Age transition, and not to the end of the Late Bronze Age; but it could have triggered the instability that led to the collapse first of Knossos and then of Bronze Age society overall. One such theory looks to the role of Cretan expertise in administering the empire, post-Thera. If this expertise was concentrated in Crete, then the Mycenaeans may have made political and commercial mistakes in administering the Cretan empire.
The Stone Age be the first of the three-age system of archaeology, which divide human technological prehistory into three periods:

Internally the Taiping Rebellion( 1851–1864), a quasi-Christian religious movement lead by the `` Heavenly King'' Hong Xiuquan, raid roughly a third of Chinese territory for over a decade until they be finally crush in the Third Battle of Nanking in 1864. This be one of the largest wars in the 19th century in terms of troop involvement; there be massive loss of life, with a death toll of about 20 million.[ 43] A string of civil disturbances follow, include the Punti–Hakka Clan Wars, Nian Rebellion, Dungan Revolt, and Panthay Rebellion.[ 44] All rebellions be ultimately put down, but at enormous cost and with millions dead, seriously weaken the central imperial authority. The Banner system that the Manchus have rely upon for so long fail: Banner forces be unable to suppress the rebels, and the government call upon local officials in the provinces, who raise `` New Armies'', which successfully crush the challenges to Qing authority. China never rebuild a strong central army, and many local officials become warlords who use military power to effectively rule independently in their provinces.[ 45]

A major breakthrough in epidemiology come with the introduction of statistical maps and graphs. They allow careful analysis of seasonality issues in disease incidents, and the maps allow public health officials to identifical critical loci for the dissemination of disease. John Snow in London develop the methods. In 1849, he observe that the symptoms of cholera, which have already claim around 500 lives within a month, be vomit and diahrrea. He conclude that the source of contamination must be through ingestion, rather than inhalation as be previously think. It be this insight that result in the removal of The Pump On Broad Street, after which deaths from cholera plummet afterwards. English nurse Florence Nightingale pioneer analysis of large amounts of statistical data, use graphs and tables, regard the condition of thousands of patients in the Crimean War to evaluate the efficacy of hospital services. Her methods prove convincing and lead to reforms in military and civilian hospitals, usually with the full support of the government.[ 115][ 116][ 117]

The first major model, implicit in most early histories of science and generally a model put forward by practice scientists themselves in their textbook literature, be associate with the criticisms of logical positivism by Karl Popper( 1902–1994) from the 1930s. Popper's model of science be one in which scientific progress be achieve through a falsification of incorrect theories and the adoption instead of theories which be progressively closer to truth. In this model, scientific progress be a linear accumulation of facts, each one add to the last. In this model, the physics of Aristotle( 384 BC – 322 BC) be simply subsume by the work of Isaac Newton( 1642–1727)( classical mechanics), which itself be eclipse by the work of Albert Einstein( 1879–1955)( Relativity), and later the theory of quantum mechanics( establish in 1925), each one more accurate than the last.

The supposed Martian canals were first reported in 1877, by the Italian astronomer Giovanni Schiaparelli. The belief in them peaked in the late 19th century, but was widely discredited in the beginning of the 20th century.

Major American studios begin to create their own `` independent'' production companies to finance and produce non-mainstream fare. One of the most successful independents of the 1990s, Miramax Films, be buy by Disney the year before the release of Tarantino's runaway hit Pulp Fiction in 1994. The same year mark the beginning of film and video distribution online. Animated films aim at family audiences also regain their popularity, with Disney's Beauty and the Beast( 1991), Aladdin( 1992), and The Lion King( 1994). During 1995, the first feature length computer-animated feature, Toy Story, be produce by Pixar Animation Studios and release by Disney. After the success of Toy Story, computer animation would grow to become the dominant technique for feature length animation, which would allow compete film companies such as DreamWorks Animation and 20th Century Fox to effectively compete with Disney with successful films of their own. During the late 1990s, another cinematic transition begin, from physical film stock to digital cinema technology. Meanwhile, DVDs become the new standard for consumer video, replace VHS tapes.

In the 3rd century BC Aristarchus of Samos be the first to suggest a heliocentric system, although only fragmentary descriptions of his idea survive.[ 27] Eratosthenes, use the angles of shadows create at widely separate regions, estimate the circumference of the Earth with great accuracy.[ 28]

The Industrial Revolution concentrate labour into mills, factories and mines, thus facilitate the organisation of combinations or trade unions to help advance the interests of work people. The power of a union could demand better terms by withdraw all labour and cause a consequent cessation of production. Employers have to decide between give in to the union demand at a cost to themselves or suffer the cost of the lost production. Skilled workers be hard to replace, and these be the first groups to successfully advance their conditions through this kind of bargaining.

Even though Northern European Bronze Age cultures were relatively late, and came in existence via trade, sites present rich and well-preserved objects made of wool, wood and imported Central European bronze and gold. Many rock carvings depict ships, and the large stone burial monuments known as stone ships suggest that shipping played an important role. Thousands of rock carvings depict ships, most probably representing sewn plank built canoes for warfare, fishing and trade. These may have a history as far back as the neolithic period and continue into the Pre-Roman Iron Age, as shown by the Hjortspring boat. There are many mounds and rock carving sites from the period. Numerous artifacts of bronze and gold are found. No written language existed in the Nordic countries during the Bronze Age. The rock carvings have been dated through comparison with depicted artifacts.

In the mid 16th-century Russians adopted printing from Central Europe, with Ivan Fyodorov being the first known Russian printer. In the 17th century printing became widespread, and woodcuts became especially popular. That led to the development of a special form of folk art known as lubok printing, which persisted in Russia well into the 19th century.

Conservation for ecologists create travails parallel those nuclear power give former Manhattan Project scientists. In each case, science have to be reconcile with individual politics, religious beliefs, and worldviews, a difficult process. Some ecologists manage to keep their science separate from their advocacy; others unrepentantly become avowed environmentalists.[ 92]
Transportation improvements, such as canals and improved roads, also lower food costs. Railroads be introduce near the end of the Industrial Revolution.

Magadha (Sanskrit: मगध) formed one of the sixteen Mahā-Janapadas (Sanskrit: "Great Countries") or kingdoms in ancient India. The core of the kingdom was the area of Bihar south of the Ganges; its first capital was Rajagriha (modern Rajgir) then Pataliputra (modern Patna). Magadha expanded to include most of Bihar and Bengal with the conquest of Licchavi and Anga respectively,[123] followed by much of eastern Uttar Pradesh and Orissa. The ancient kingdom of Magadha is heavily mentioned in Jain and Buddhist texts. It is also mentioned in the Ramayana, Mahabharata, Puranas.[124] The earliest reference to the Magadha people occurs in the Atharva-Veda where they are found listed along with the Angas, Gandharis, and Mujavats. Magadha played an important role in the development of Jainism and Buddhism, and two of India's greatest empires, the Maurya Empire and Gupta Empire, originated from Magadha. These empires saw advancements in ancient India's science, mathematics, astronomy, religion, and philosophy and were considered the Indian "Golden Age". The Magadha kingdom included republican communities such as the community of Rajakumara. Villages had their own assemblies under their local chiefs called Gramakas. Their administrations were divided into executive, judicial, and military functions.

Assyro-Babylonian literature, written in the Akkadian language, of Mesopotamia (Assyria and Babylonia) continues into the Iron Age up until the 6th centuries BC. The oldest Phoenician alphabet inscription is the Ahiram epitaph, engraved on the sarcophagus of King Ahiram from circa 1200 BC.[20] It has become conventional to refer to the alphabetic script as "Proto-Canaanite" until the mid-11th century BC, when it is first attested on inscribed bronze arrowheads, and as "Phoenician" only after 1050 BC.[21] The Paleo-Hebrew alphabet is identical to the Phoenician alphabet and dates to the 10th century BC.

Ibn Sina( Avicenna) be regard as the most influential philosopher of Islam.[ 70] He pioneer the science of experimental medicine[ 71] and be the first physician to conduct clinical trials.[ 72] His two most notable works in medicine be the Kitāb al-shifāʾ( `` Book of Healing'') and The Canon of Medicine, both of which be use as standard medicinal texts in both the Muslim world and in Europe well into the 17th century. Amongst his many contributions be the discovery of the contagious nature of infectious diseases,[ 71] and the introduction of clinical pharmacology.[ 73]

Marx's work turned the labor theory of value, as the classicists called it, on its head. His dark irony goes deeper by asking what is the socially necessary labor time for the production of labor (i.e. working people) itself. Marx answers that this is the bare minimum for people to subsist and to reproduce with skills necessary in the economy.[54]
For the emergence of 20th century modern dance see also: Mary Wigman, Gret Palucca, Harald Kreutzberg, Yvonne Georgi, and Isadora Duncan.

The writings of Greek physician Galen have dominate European medical thinking for over a millennium. The Italian scholar Vesalius demonstrate mistakes in the Gaelic's ideas. Vesalius dissect human corpses, whereas Galen dissect animal corpses. Published in 1543, Vesalius' De humani corporis fabrica[ 77] be a groundbreaking work of human anatomy. It emphasize the priority of dissection and what have come to be call the `` anatomical'' view of the body, see human internal functioning as an essentially corporeal structure fill with organs arrange in three-dimensional space. This be in stark contrast to many of the anatomical models use previously, which have strong Galenic/Aristotelean elements, as well as elements of astrology.

It was not until Prince Henry the Navigator began in 1418 to encourage the penetration of the torrid zone in the effort to reach India by circumnavigating Africa that European exploration of the southern hemisphere began. In 1473 Portuguese navigator Lopes Gonçalves proved that the equator could be crossed, and cartographers and sailors began to assume the existence of another, temperate continent to the south of the known world.

The Akan speak a Kwa language. The speakers of Kwa languages be believe to have come from East/Central Africa, before settle in the Sahel.[ 180] By the 12th century, the Akan Kingdom of Bonoman( Bono State) be establish. During the 13th century, when the gold mines in modern-day Mali start to dry up, Bonoman and later other Akan states begin to rise to prominence as the major players in the Gold trade. It be Bonoman and other Akan kingdoms like Denkyira, Akyem, Akwamu which be the predecessors to what become the all-powerful Empire of Ashanti. When and how the Ashante get to their present location be debatable. What be know be that by the 17th century an Akan people be identify as living in a state call Kwaaman. The location of the state be north of Lake Bosomtwe. The state's revenue be mainly derive from trading in gold and kola nuts and clear forest to plant yams. They build towns between the Pra and Ofin rivers. They form alliances for defense and pay tribute to Denkyira one of the more powerful Akan states at that time along with Adansi and Akwamu. During the 16th century, Ashante society experience sudden changes, include population growth because of cultivation of New World plants such as cassava and maize and an increase in the gold trade between the coast and the north.[ 181]

By 4 million years ago, several australopithecine hominid species had developed throughout Southern, Eastern and Central Africa. They were tool users, and makers of tools. They scavenged for meat and were omnivores.[5]

The Hellenic civilisation was a collection of city-states or poleis with different governments and cultures that achieved notable developments in government, philosophy, science, mathematics, politics, sports, theatre and music.

After the North Magnetic Pole be locate in 1831, explorers and scientists begin look for the South Magnetic Pole. One of the explorers, James Clark Ross, a British naval officer, identify its approximate location, but be unable to reach it on his trip in 1841. Commanding the British ships Erebus and Terror, he brave the pack ice and approach what be now know as the Ross Ice Shelf, a massive floating ice shelf over 100 feet( 30 m) high. His expedition sail eastward along the southern Antarctic coast discovering mountains which be since name after his ships: Mount Erebus, the most active volcano on Antarctica, and Mount Terror.[ 10]

The bronzes of the Western Zhou Dynasty document large portions of history not found in the extant texts that were often composed by persons of varying rank and possibly even social class. Further, the medium of cast bronze lends the record they preserve a permanence not enjoyed by manuscripts.[45] These inscriptions can commonly be subdivided into four parts: a reference to the date and place, the naming of the event commemorated, the list of gifts given to the artisan in exchange for the bronze, and a dedication.[46] The relative points of reference these vessels provide have enabled historians to place most of the vessels within a certain time frame of the Western Zhou period, allowing them to trace the evolution of the vessels and the events they record.[47]

Early medical traditions include those of Babylon, China, Egypt and India. The Greeks go even further, introduce the concepts of medical diagnosis, prognosis, and advance medical ethics. The Hippocratic Oath, still take( although significantly change from the original) by doctors up to today, be write in Greece in the 5th century BCE. In the medieval age, surgical practices inherit from the ancient masters be improve and then systematize in Rogerius's The Practice of Surgery. Universities begin systematic training of physicians around the years 1220 in Italy. During the Renaissance, understanding of anatomy improve, and the microscope be invent.

After the marriage in 1476 of King Matthias to Beatrice of Naples, Buda become one of the most important artistic centres of the Renaissance north of the Alps.[ 93] The most important humanists live in Matthias' court be Antonio Bonfini and the famous Hungarian poet Janus Pannonius.[ 93] András Hess set up a printing press in Buda in 1472. Matthias Corvinus's library, the Bibliotheca Corviniana, be Europe's greatest collections of secular books: historical chronicles, philosophic and scientific works in the 15th century. His library be second only in size to the Vatican Library.( However, the Vatican Library mainly contain Bibles and religious materials.)[ 94]

Around 1900 a number of architects around the world begin develop new architectural solutions to integrate traditional precedents with new social demands and technological possibilities. The work of Victor Horta and Henry van de Velde in Brussels, Antoni Gaudí in Barcelona, Otto Wagner in Vienna and Charles Rennie Mackintosh in Glasgow, among many others, can be see as a common struggle between old and new.

Resistance to the growing influence of molecular biology was especially evident in evolutionary biology. Protein sequencing had great potential for the quantitative study of evolution (through the molecular clock hypothesis), but leading evolutionary biologists questioned the relevance of molecular biology for answering the big questions of evolutionary causation. Departments and disciplines fractured as organismic biologists asserted their importance and independence: Theodosius Dobzhansky made the famous statement that "nothing in biology makes sense except in the light of evolution" as a response to the molecular challenge. The issue became even more critical after 1968; Motoo Kimura's neutral theory of molecular evolution suggested that natural selection was not the ubiquitous cause of evolution, at least at the molecular level, and that molecular evolution might be a fundamentally different process from morphological evolution. (Resolving this "molecular/morphological paradox" has been a central focus of molecular evolution research since the 1960s.)[78]

Eventually the natives and the Spaniards interbreed, form a Mestizo class. Mestizos and the Native Americans be often force to pay unfair taxes to the Spanish government( although all subjects pay taxes) and be punish harshly for disobey their laws. Many native artworks be consider pagan idols and destroy by Spanish explorers. This include a great number of gold and silver sculptures, which be melt down before transport to Europe.[ citation need]
It be only in the late 19th century that the Neogrammarian approach of Karl Brugmann and others introduce a rigid notion of sound law.

As the Western Roman Empire fell into decay through the 4th and 5th centuries, the seat of Roman power shift to Constantinople and the Eastern Roman Empire, today call the Byzantine Empire. While survive evidence about Byzantine theatre be slight, exist records show that mime, pantomime, scenes or recitations from tragedies and comedies, dances, and other entertainments be very popular. Constantinople have two theatres that be in use as late as the 5th century.[ 32] However, the true importance of the Byzantines in theatrical history be their preservation of many classical Greek texts and the compilation of a massive encyclopedia call the Suda, from which be derive a large amount of contemporary information on Greek theatre.

In the early 15th century, the countries of the Iberian peninsula begin to sponsor exploration beyond the boundaries of Europe. Prince Henry the Navigator of Portugal( d. 1460) send expeditions that discover the Canary Islands, the Azores, and Cape Verde during his lifetime. After his death, exploration continue; Bartolomeu Dias( d. 1500) go around the Cape of Good Hope in 1486 and Vasco da Gama( d. 1524) sail around Africa to India in 1498.[ 308] The combined Spanish monarchies of Castile and Aragon sponsor the voyage of exploration by Christopher Columbus( d. 1506) in 1492 that discover the Americas.[ 309] The English crown under Henry VII sponsor the voyage of John Cabot( d. 1498) in 1497, which land on Cape Breton Island.[ 310]

In 1789 the Mutiny on the Bounty against William Bligh led to several of the mutineers escaping the Royal Navy and settling on Pitcairn Islands, which later became a British colony. Britain also established colonies in Australia in 1788, New Zealand in 1840 and Fiji in 1872, with much of Oceania becoming part of the British Empire.

These bills could also be use as a form of payment by the seller to make additional purchases from his own suppliers. Thus, the bills – an early form of credit – become both a medium of exchange and a medium for storage of value. Like the loans make by the Egyptian grain banks, this trade credit become a significant source for the creation of new money. In England, bills of exchange become an important form of credit and money during last quarter of the 18th century and the first quarter of the 19th century before banknotes, checks and cash credit lines be widely available.[ 76]

Dance history is difficult to access because dance does not often leave behind clearly identifiable physical artifacts that last over millennia, such as stone tools, hunting implements or cave paintings. It is not possible to identify with exact precision when dance became part of human culture.

The early 1960s also signal the start of major clashes between the Hutus and the Tutsis in Rwanda and Burundi. In 1994 this culminate in the Rwandan Genocide, a conflict in which over 800,000 people be murder.[ 225]

Historian and political philosopher Quentin Skinner points out that Otto of Freising (c. 1114–1158), a German bishop visiting north Italy during the 12th century, noticed a widespread new form of political and social organization, observing that Italy appeared to have exited from Feudalism so that its society was based on merchants and commerce. Linked to this was anti-monarchical thinking, represented in the famous early Renaissance fresco cycle Allegory of Good and Bad Government in Siena by Ambrogio Lorenzetti (painted 1338–1340), whose strong message is about the virtues of fairness, justice, republicanism and good administration. Holding both Church and Empire at bay, these city republics were devoted to notions of liberty. Skinner reports that there were many defences of liberty such as the Matteo Palmieri (1406–1475) celebration of Florentine genius not only in art, sculpture and architecture, but "the remarkable efflorescence of moral, social and political philosophy that occurred in Florence at the same time".[31]

Alfred Marshall( 1842–1924) be also credit with an attempt to put economics on a more mathematical footing. The first professor of economics at the University of Cambridge, his 1890 work Principles of Economics[ 55] abandon the term `` political economy'' for his favorite `` economics''. He view math as a way to simplify economic reasoning, although he have reservations as reveal in a letter to his student Arthur Cecil Pigou:[ 40][ 56]

The construction of cathedrals and castles advance building technology, lead to the development of large stone buildings. Ancillary structures include new town halls, houses, bridges, and tithe barns.[ 232] Shipbuilding improve with the use of the rib and plank method rather than the old Roman system of mortise and tenon. Other improvements to ships include the use of lateen sails and the stern-post rudder, both of which increase the speed at which ships could be sail.[ 233]

The increase use of the English language globally have have an effect on other languages, lead to some English words be assimilate into the vocabularies of other languages. This influence of English have lead to concerns about language death,[ 127] and to claims of linguistic imperialism,[ 128] and have provoke resistance to the spread of English; however the number of speakers continue to increase because many people around the world think that English provide them with opportunities for better employment and improved lives.[ 129]

Scientific thought in Classical Antiquity becomes tangible from the 6th century BC in pre-Socratic philosophy (Thales, Pythagoras). In c. 385 BC, Plato founded the Academy. With Plato's student Aristotle begins the "scientific revolution" of the Hellenistic period culminating in the 3rd to 2nd centuries with scholars such as Eratosthenes, Euclid, Aristarchus of Samos, Hipparchus and Archimedes.

Passive constructions also use auxiliary verbs. A passive construction rephrases an active construction in such a way that the object of the active phrase becomes the subject of the passive phrase, and the subject of the active phrase is either omitted or demoted to a role as an oblique argument introduced in a prepositional phrase. They are formed by using the past participle either with the auxiliary verb to be or to get, although not all varieties of English allow the use of passives with get. For example, putting the sentence she sees him into the passive becomes he is seen (by her), or he gets seen (by her).[192]

Scholars have argued that warfare was absent throughout much of human's prehistoric past, and that it emerged after sedentism, farming, and more complex political systems arose.[12] However, the findings at the site of Nataruk in Turkana County, Kenya, where the remains of 27 individuals who died as the result of an intentional attack by another group 10,000 years ago, show that inter-group conflict has a much longer history.[13]

The Ghana Empire grew wealthy by taxing the trans-Saharan trade that linked Tiaret and Sijilmasa to Aoudaghost. Ghana controlled access to the goldfields of Bambouk, southeast of Koumbi Saleh. A percentage of salt and gold going through its territory was taken. The empire was not involved in production.[167]

As in ancient Greece, early Chinese thinkers be concern with the relationship between names and reality. Confucius( 6th century BCE) famously emphasize the moral commitment implicit in a name,( zhengming) state that the moral collapse of the pre-Qin be a result of the failure to rectify behaviour to meet the moral commitment inherent in names: `` Good government consist in the ruler be a ruler, the minister be a minister, the father be a father, and the son be a son ... If names be not correct, language be not in accordance with the truth of things.''( Analects 12.11,13.3).

In 1533, Pizarro invaded Cuzco with indigenous troops and wrote to King Charles I: "This city is the greatest and the finest ever seen in this country or anywhere in the Indies ... it is so beautiful and has such fine buildings that it would be remarkable even in Spain." After the Spanish had sealed the conquest of Peru, Jauja in fertile Mantaro Valley was established as Peru's provisional capital, but it was too far up in the mountains, and Pizarro founded the city of Lima on 18 January 1535, which Pizarro considered one of the most important acts in his life.

The Greeks and the Romans leave a legacy in Europe which be evident in European languages, think, visual arts and law. Ancient Greece be a collection of city-states, out of which the original form of democracy develop. Athens be the most powerful and developed city, and a cradle of learn from the time of Pericles. Citizens' forums debate and legislated policy of the state, and from here arose some of the most notable classical philosophers, such as Socrates, Plato, and Aristotle, the last of whom taught Alexander the Great.

In the Scottish Enlightenment, Scotland's major cities create an intellectual infrastructure of mutually support institutions such as universities, read societies, libraries, periodicals, museums and masonic lodges.[ 82] The Scottish network be `` predominantly liberal Calvinist, Newtonian, and'design' orient in character which play a major role in the further development of the transatlantic Enlightenment''.[ 83] In France, Voltaire say `` we look to Scotland for all our ideas of civilization. ``[ 84] The focus of the Scottish Enlightenment range from intellectual and economic matters to the specifically scientific as in the work of William Cullen, physician and chemist; James Anderson, an agronomist; Joseph Black, physicist and chemist; and James Hutton, the first modern geologist.[ 16][ 85]

Finally, cuneiform writing become a general purpose write system for logograms, syllables, and numbers. By the 26th century BC, this script have be adapt to another Mesopotamian language, Akkadian, and from there to others such as Hurrian, and Hittite. Scripts similar in appearance to this write system include those for Ugaritic and Old Persian.

Thales of Miletus is one of the first known philosophers known to have wondered about the shape of the world. He proposed that the world was based on water, and that all things grew out of it. He also laid down many of the astronomical and mathematical rules that would allow geography to be studied scientifically. His successor Anaximander is the first person known to have attempted to create a scale map of the known world and to have introduced the gnomon to Ancient Greece.

The next crucial breakthrough be in 1488, when Bartolomeu Dias round the southern tip of Africa, which he name `` Cape of Storms''( Cabo das Tormentas), anchor at Mossel Bay and then sail east as far as the mouth of the Great Fish River, prove that the Indian Ocean be accessible from the Atlantic. Simultaneously Pêro da Covilhã, send out travel secretly overland, have reach Ethiopia have collect important information about the Red Sea and Quenia coast, suggest that a sea route to the Indies would soon be forthcoming.[ 57] Soon the cape be rename by king John II of Portugal the `` Cape of Good Hope''( Cabo da Boa Esperança), because of the great optimism engender by the possibility of a sea route to India, prove false the view that have exist since Ptolemy that the Indian Ocean be land-locked.

The Chittorgarh Fort be the largest in India; it be a symbol for Rajput resistance. Chittorgarh Fort be sack three times during the 15th and 16th centuries by Muslim armies. In 1303 Allauddin Khilji defeat Rana Ratan Singh; in 1535 Bahadur Shah, the Sultanate of Gujarat defeat Bikramjeet Singh; and in 1567 Akbar defeat Maharana Udai Singh II, who leave the fort and found Udaipur. Each time the men fight bravely rush out of the fort walls charge the enemy, but lose. Following these defeats, Jauhar be commit thrice by many of the wives and children of the Rajput soldiers who give their lives in battles at Chittorgarh Fort. The first time, this be lead by Rani Padmini wife of Rana Rattan Singh who be kill in the battle in 1303, and later by Rani Karnavati in 1537.[ 272][ 273][ 274]

Blaise Pascal( 1623–1662) invent the mechanical calculator in 1642.[ 98] The introduction of his Pascaline in 1645 launch the development of mechanical calculators first in Europe and then all over the world.[ 99][ 100] Gottfried Leibniz( 1646–1716), build on Pascal's work, become one of the most prolific inventors in the field of mechanical calculators; he be the first to describe a pinwheel calculator, in 1685,[ 101] and invent the Leibniz wheel, use in the arithmometer, the first mass-produced mechanical calculator. He also refine the binary number system, foundation of virtually all modern computer architectures.[ 102]

The Western Chalukya Empire( Kannada: ಪಶ್ಚಿಮ ಚಾಲುಕ್ಯ ಸಾಮ್ರಾಜ್ಯ) rule most of the western Deccan, South India, between the 10th and 12th centuries.[ 243] Vast areas between the Narmada River in the north and Kaveri River in the south come under Chalukya control.[ 243] During this period the other major rule families of the Deccan, the Hoysalas, the Seuna Yadavas of Devagiri, the Kakatiya dynasty and the Southern Kalachuris, be subordinates of the Western Chalukyas and gain their independence only when the power of the Chalukya wan during the later half of the 12th century.[ 244] The Western Chalukyas develop an architectural style know today as a transitional style, an architectural link between the style of the early Chalukya dynasty and that of the later Hoysala empire. Most of its monuments be in the districts border the Tungabhadra River in central Karnataka. Well known examples be the Kasivisvesvara Temple at Lakkundi, the Mallikarjuna Temple at Kuruvatti, the Kallesvara Temple at Bagali and the Mahadeva Temple at Itagi.[ 245] This be an important period in the development of fine arts in Southern India, especially in literature as the Western Chalukya kings encourage writers in the native language of Kannada, and Sanskrit like the philosopher and statesman Basava and the great mathematician Bhāskara II.[ 246][ 247]

During the colonial era, Western influences started to make an impact on Indian art. Some artists developed a style that used Western ideas of composition, perspective and realism to illustrate Indian themes. Others, like Jamini Roy, consciously drew inspiration from folk art.

Under Peter I (the Great), Russia was proclaimed an Empire in 1721 and became recognized as a world power. Ruling from 1682 to 1725, Peter defeated Sweden in the Great Northern War, forcing it to cede West Karelia and Ingria (two regions lost by Russia in the Time of Troubles),[62] as well as Estland and Livland, securing Russia's access to the sea and sea trade.[63] On the Baltic Sea Peter founded a new capital called Saint Petersburg, later known as Russia's Window to Europe. Peter the Great's reforms brought considerable Western European cultural influences to Russia. Catherine II (the Great), who ruled in 1762–96, extended Russian political control over the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth and incorporated most of its territories into Russia during the Partitions of Poland, pushing the Russian frontier westward into Central Europe. In the south, after successful Russo-Turkish Wars against the Ottoman Empire, Catherine advanced Russia's boundary to the Black Sea, defeating the Crimean khanate.

Early Christian thought, in particular in the patristic period, tend to be intuitional and mystical, and be less reliant on reason and logical argument. It also place more emphasis on the sometimes-mystical doctrines of Plato, and less upon the systematic thinking of Aristotle. Much of the work of Aristotle be unknown in the West in this period. Scholars rely on translations by Boethius into Latin of Aristotle's Categories, the logical work On Interpretation, and his Latin translation of Porphyry's Isagoge, a commentary on Aristotle's Categories.

The major opponent of Freemasonry be the Roman Catholic Church, so that in countries with a large Catholic element, such as France, Italy, Spain, and Mexico, much of the ferocity of the political battles involve the confrontation between what Davies call the reactionary Church and enlighten Freemasonry.[ 223][ 224] Even in France, Masons do not act as a group.[ 225] American historians, while note that Benjamin Franklin and George Washington be indeed active Masons, have downplay the importance of Freemasonry in cause the American Revolution because the Masonic order be non-political and include both Patriots and their enemy the Loyalists.[ 226]

One common conception of modernity be the condition of Western history since the mid-15th century, or roughly the European development of movable type[ 24] and the printing press.[ 25] In this context the `` modern'' society be say to develop over many periods, and to be influence by important events that represent breaks in the continuity.[ 26][ 27][ 28]

The answer, provide by Arthur D. Little to the president of MIT, be to emphasize the approach chemical engineers take to the design and analysis of processes rather than a process or a product. The concept of Unit operations be develop to emphasize the underlying unity among seemingly different operations. For example, the principles be the same whether one be concern about separate alcohol from water in a fermenter, or separate gasoline from diesel in a refinery, as long as the basis of separation be generation of a vapor of a different composition from the liquid. Therefore, such separation processes can be study together as a unit operation( in this case call distillation). The concept have stand the profession in good stead in its phase of growth, and have even be use to understand the way the human body functions.

In Latin America in the 1970s, leftists acquire a significant political influence which prompt the right-wing, ecclesiastical authorities and a large portion of the individual country's upper class to support coups d'état to avoid what they perceive as a communist threat. This be further fuel by Cuban and United States intervention which lead to a political polarization. Most South American countries be in some periods rule by military dictatorships that be support by the United States of America. In the 1970s, the regimes of the Southern Cone collaborate in Operation Condor kill many leftist dissidents, include some urban guerrillas.[ 119] However, by the early 1990s all countries have restore their democracies.

The National Geographic Society be found in the United States in 1888 and begin publication of the National Geographic magazine which become and continue to be a great popularizer of geographic information. The society have long support geographic research and education.

The Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency is an agency of the United States Department of Defense responsible for the development of new technologies for use by the military. DARPA leads the development of military technology in the United States and today, has dozens of ongoing projects; everything from humanoid robots, to bullets that are able to change path before reaching their target. China has a similar agency.

In 284 AD, Diocletian be hail as Imperator by the eastern army. Diocletian heal the empire from the crisis, by political and economic shifts. A new form of government be establish: the Tetrarchy. The Empire be divide among four emperors, two in the West and two in the East. The first tetrarchs be Diocletian( in the East), Maximian( in the West), and two junior emperors, Galerius( in the East) and Flavius Constantius( in the West). To adjust the economy, Diocletian make several tax reforms.[ 124]

Titus have a short-lived rule; he be emperor from 79–81 AD. He finish the Flavian Amphitheater, which be construct with war spoils from the First Jewish-Roman War, and promote games celebrate the victory over the Jews that last for a hundred days. These games include gladiatorial combats, chariot races and a sensational mock naval battle on the flooded grounds of the Colosseum.[ 90][ 91]
The Heroic Age of Antarctic Exploration began at the end of the 19th century and closed with Ernest Shackleton's Imperial Trans-Antarctic Expedition in 1917.[13]

Some of the first geological thoughts be about the origin of the Earth. Ancient Greece develop some primary geological concepts concern the origin of the Earth. Additionally, in the 4th century BC Aristotle make critical observations of the slow rate of geological change. He observe the composition of the land and formulate a theory where the Earth changes at a slow rate and that these changes can not be observe during one person’s lifetime. Aristotle develop one of the first evidentially base concepts connect to the geological realm regard the rate at which the Earth physically change.[ 2][ 3]

Thus begin Australia's involvement in the six-year global conflict. Australians be to fight in an extraordinary variety of locations, from withstand the advance of Hitler's Panzers in the Siege of Tobruk; to turn back the advance of the Imperial Japanese Army in the New Guinea Campaign. From bomber missions over Europe and Mediterranean naval engagements, to face Japanese mini-sub raids on Sydney Harbour and devastate air raids on the city of Darwin.[ 312]

The Classic Era was dominated by numerous independent city-states in the Maya region and also featured the beginnings of political unity in central Mexico and the Yucatán. Regional differences between cultures grew more manifest. The city-state of Teotihuacan dominated the Valley of Mexico until the early 8th century, but we know little of the political structure of the region because the Teotihuacanos left no written records. The city-state of Monte Albán dominated the Valley of Oaxaca until the late Classic, leaving limited records in their mostly undeciphered script. Highly sophisticated arts such as stuccowork, architecture, sculptural reliefs, mural painting, pottery, and lapidary developed and spread during the Classic era.
For over a century after Tasman's voyages, until the era of James Cook, Tasmania and New Zealand be not visit by Europeans – mainland Australia be visit, but usually only by accident.

In 1533, a fourteen-year-old Caterina de' Medici( 1519–1589), bear in Florence to Lorenzo II de' Medici and Madeleine de la Tour d'Auvergne, marry Henry II of France, second son of King Francis I and Queen Claude. Though she become famous and infamous for her role in France's religious wars, she make a direct contribution in bring arts, sciences and music( include the origins of ballet) to the French court from her native Florence.

In 1905 a young, 26-year-old German physicist (then a Bern patent clerk) named Albert Einstein (1879–1955), showed how measurements of time and space are affected by motion between an observer and what is being observed. To say that Einstein's radical theory of relativity revolutionized science is no exaggeration. Although Einstein made many other important contributions to science, the theory of relativity alone represents one of the greatest intellectual achievements of all time. Although the concept of relativity was not introduced by Einstein, his major contribution was the recognition that the speed of light in a vacuum is constant, i.e. the same for all observers, and an absolute physical boundary for motion. This does not impact a person's day-to-day life since most objects travel at speeds much slower than light speed. For objects travelling near light speed, however, the theory of relativity shows that clocks associated with those objects will run more slowly and that the objects shorten in length according to measurements of an observer on Earth. Einstein also derived the famous equation, E = mc2, which expresses the equivalence of mass and energy.

Further studies, e.g. Jerome Ravetz 1971 Scientific Knowledge and its Social Problems referred to the role of the scientific community, as a social construct, in accepting or rejecting (objective) scientific knowledge.[128] The Science wars of the 1990 were about the influence of especially French philosophers, which denied the objectivity of science in general or seemed to do so. They described as well differences between the idealized model of a pure science and the actual scientific practice; while scientism, a revival of the positivism approach, saw in precise measurement and rigorous calculation the basis for finally settling enduring metaphysical and moral controversies.[129][130] However, more recently some of the leading critical theorists have recognized that their postmodern deconstructions have at times been counter-productive, and are providing intellectual ammunition for reactionary interests. Bruno Latour noted that "dangerous extremists are using the very same argument of social construction to destroy hard-won evidence that could save our lives. Was I wrong to participate in the invention of this field known as science studies? Is it enough to say that we did not really mean what we meant?"[131]

The city of Rome grew from settlements around a ford on the river Tiber, a crossroads of traffic and trade.[12] According to archaeological evidence, the village of Rome was probably founded some time in the 8th century BC, though it may go back as far as the 10th century BC, by members of the Latin tribe of Italy, on the top of the Palatine Hill.[18][19]

The term theatre practitioner came to be used to describe someone who both creates theatrical performances and who produces a theoretical discourse that informs their practical work.[80] A theatre practitioner may be a director, a dramatist, an actor, or—characteristically—often a combination of these traditionally separate roles. "Theatre practice" describes the collective work that various theatre practitioners do.[81] It is used to describe theatre praxis from Konstantin Stanislavski's development of his 'system', through Vsevolod Meyerhold's biomechanics, Bertolt Brecht's epic and Jerzy Grotowski's poor theatre, down to the present day, with contemporary theatre practitioners including Augusto Boal with his Theatre of the Oppressed, Dario Fo's popular theatre, Eugenio Barba's theatre anthropology and Anne Bogart's viewpoints.[82]

Around 1.8 million years ago, Homo ergaster first appeared in the fossil record in Africa. From Homo ergaster, Homo erectus evolved 1.5 million years ago. Some of the earlier representatives of this species were still fairly small-brained and used primitive stone tools, much like H. habilis. The brain later grew in size, and H. erectus eventually developed a more complex stone tool technology called the Acheulean. Possibly the first hunters, H. erectus mastered the art of making fire and was the first hominid to leave Africa, colonizing most of Afro-Eurasia and perhaps later giving rise to Homo floresiensis. Although some recent writers suggest that Homo georgicus was the first and most primitive hominid ever to live outside Africa, many scientists consider H. georgicus to be an early and primitive member of the H. erectus species.[7][8]

The first settlements in Fiji were started by voyaging traders and settlers from the west about 5000 years ago. Lapita pottery shards have been found at numerous excavations around the country. Aspects of Fijian culture are similar to the Melanesian culture of the western Pacific but have a stronger connection to the older Polynesian cultures. Across 1,000 kilometres (620 mi) from east to west, Fiji has been a nation of many languages. Fiji's history was one of settlement but also of mobility.

Unfortunately, Wegener provide no convincing mechanism for this drift, and his ideas be not generally accept during his lifetime. Arthur Homes accept Wegener’s theory and provide a mechanism: mantle convection, to cause the continents to move.[ 36] However, it be not until after the Second World War that new evidence start to accumulate that supported continental drift. There follow a period of 20 extremely exciting years where the Theory of Continental Drift develop from be believe by a few to be the cornerstone of modern Geology. Beginning in 1947 research find new evidence about the ocean floor, and in 1960 Bruce C. Heezen publish the concept of mid-ocean ridges.Soon after this, Robert S. Dietz and Harry H. Hess propose that the oceanic crust forms as the seafloor spreads apart along mid-ocean ridges in seafloor spreading.[ 37] This be see as confirmation of mantle convection and so the major stumble block to the theory be remove. Geophysical evidence suggest lateral motion of continents and that oceanic crust be younger than continental crust. This geophysical evidence also spur the hypothesis of paleomagnetism, the record of the orientation of the Earth’s magnetic field record in magnetic minerals. British geophysicist S. K. Runcorn suggest the concept of paleomagnetism from his finding that the continents have move relative to the Earth’s magnetic poles. Tuzo Wilson, who be a promoter of the sea floor spread hypothesis and continental drift from the very beginning,[ 38] add the concept of transform faults to the model, complete the classes of fault types necessary to make the mobility of the plates on the globe function.[ 39] A symposium on continental drift[ 40] be hold at the Royal Society of London in 1965 must be regard as the official start of the acceptance of plate tectonics by the scientific community.The abstracts from the symposium be issue as Blacket, Bullard, Runcorn; 1965.In this symposium, Edward Bullard and co-workers show with a computer calculation how the continents along both sides of the Atlantic would best fit to close the ocean, which become know as the famous `` Bullard's Fit''. By the late 1960s the weight of the evidence available saw Continental Drift as the generally accept theory.

The most immediate cause of the new adjustments appear to have be an increase aridity in the region and consequent contraction of parkland savanna, intersperse with trees and groves, in favor of open grassland, date 1.8–1.7 mya. During that transitional period the percentage of grazers among the fossil species increase from 15–25% to 45%, disperse the food supply and require a facility among the hunters to travel longer distances comfortably, which H. erectus obviously have.[ 33] The ultimate proof be the `` dispersal'' of H. erectus `` across much of Africa and Asia, substantially before the development of the Mode 2 technology and use of fire ....''[ 32] H. erectus carry Mode 1 tools over Eurasia.

There be also an increase awareness of foreign language cinema in America during this period. During the late 1950s and 1960s, the French New Wave directors such as François Truffaut and Jean-Luc Godard produce films such as Les quatre cents coups, Breathless and Jules et Jim which break the rules of Hollywood cinema's narrative structure. As well, audiences be become aware of Italian films like Federico Fellini's La Dolce Vita and the stark dramas of Sweden's Ingmar Bergman.

The rapid industrialisation of the English economy cost many craft workers their jobs. The movement start first with lace and hosiery workers near Nottingham and spread to other areas of the textile industry owe to early industrialisation. Many weavers also find themselves suddenly unemployed since they could no longer compete with machines which only require relatively limited( and unskilled) labour to produce more cloth than a single weaver. Many such unemployed workers, weavers and others, turn their animosity towards the machines that have take their jobs and begin destroy factories and machinery. These attackers become know as Luddites, supposedly followers of Ned Ludd, a folklore figure. The first attacks of the Luddite movement begin in 1811. The Luddites rapidly gain popularity, and the British government take drastic measures, use the militia or army to protect industry. Those rioters who be catch be try and hang, or transport for life.

The main method the unions used to effect change was strike action. Many strikes were painful events for both sides, the unions and the management. In Britain, the Combination Act 1799 forbade workers to form any kind of trade union until its repeal in 1824. Even after this, unions were still severely restricted.

Coal mining was very dangerous owing to the presence of firedamp in many coal seams. Some degree of safety was provided by the safety lamp which was invented in 1816 by Sir Humphry Davy and independently by George Stephenson. However, the lamps proved a false dawn because they became unsafe very quickly and provided a weak light. Firedamp explosions continued, often setting off coal dust explosions, so casualties grew during the entire 19th century. Conditions of work were very poor, with a high casualty rate from rock falls.

Available methods of communication have improved tremendously over time. Instead of waiting months or years for a hand-copied letter to arrive, today scientific communication can be practically instantaneous. Earlier, most natural philosophers worked in relative isolation, due to the difficulty and slowness of communication. Still, there was a considerable amount of cross-fertilization between distant groups and individuals.
