It was in this context that the so-called American School of Anthropology thrived as the champion of polygenism or the doctrine of multiple origins—sparking a debate between those influenced by the Bible who believed in the unity of humanity and those who argued from a scientific standpoint for the plurality of origins and the antiquity of distinct types. Like the monogenists, these theories were not monolithic and often used words like races, species, hybrid, and mongrel interchangeably. A scientific consensus began to emerge during this period "that there exists a Genus Homo, embracing many primordial types of ‘species’." Charles Caldwell, Samuel George Morton, Samuel A. Cartwright, George Gliddon, Josiah C. Nott, and Louis Agassiz, and even South Carolina Governor James Henry Hammond were all influential proponents of this school. While some were disinterested scientists, others were passionate advocates who used science to promote slavery in a period of increasing sectional strife. All were complicit in establishing the putative science that justified slavery, informed the Dred Scott decision, underpinned miscegenation laws, and eventually fueled Jim Crow. Samuel G. Morton, for example, claimed to be just a scientist but he did not hesitate to provide evidence of Negro inferiority to John C. Calhoun, the prominent pro-slavery Secretary of State to help him negotiate the annexation of Texas as a slave state.

In addition to the necessity of public leadership in certain sectors Smith argued, secondly, that cartels were undesirable because of their potential to limit production and quality of goods and services.[35] Thirdly, Smith criticised government support of any kind of monopoly which always charges the highest price "which can be squeezed out of the buyers".[36] The existence of monopoly and the potential for cartels, which would later form the core of competition law policy, could distort the benefits of free markets to the advantage of businesses at the expense of consumer sovereignty.

The First Viennese School of Medicine, 1750–1800, be lead by the Dutchman Gerard van Swieten( 1700–1772), who aim to put medicine on new scientific foundations- promoting unprejudiced clinical observation, botanical and chemical research, and introduce simple but powerful remedies. When the Vienna General Hospital open in 1784, it at once become the world's largest hospital and physicians acquire a facility that gradually develop into the most important research centre.[ 106] Progress end with the Napoleonic wars and the government shutdown in 1819 of all liberal journals and schools; this cause a general return to traditionalism and eclecticism in medicine.[ 107]

Up to and during the 1930s, electrical engineers were able to build electronic circuits to solve mathematical and logic problems, but most did so in an ad hoc manner, lacking any theoretical rigor. This changed with Claude Elwood Shannon's publication of his 1937 master's thesis, A Symbolic Analysis of Relay and Switching Circuits. While taking an undergraduate philosophy class, Shannon had been exposed to Boole's work, and recognized that it could be used to arrange electromechanical relays (then used in telephone routing switches) to solve logic problems. This concept, of utilizing the properties of electrical switches to do logic, is the basic concept that underlies all electronic digital computers, and his thesis became the foundation of practical digital circuit design when it became widely known among the electrical engineering community during and after World War II .[citation needed]
In 1959 the non-contiguous US territories of Alaska and Hawaii became US states.

A Mode 2 tool be a biface consist of two concave surfaces intersect to form a cutting edge all the way around, except in the case of tools intend to feature a point. More work and planning go into the manufacture of a Mode 2 tool. The manufacturer hit a slab off a larger rock to use as a blank. Then large flakes be strike off the blank and work into bifaces by hard-hammer percussion on an anvil stone. Finally the edge be retouch: small flakes be hit off with a bone or wood soft hammer to sharpen or resharpen it. The core can be either the blank or another flake. Blanks be port for manufacture supply in places where nature have provide no suitable stone.

The earliest definite human remains found to date are that of Mungo Man, which have been dated at about 40,000 years old, but the time of arrival of the ancestors of Indigenous Australians is a matter of debate among researchers, with estimates dating back as far as 125,000 years ago.[56] There is great diversity among different Indigenous communities and societies in Australia, each with its own unique mixture of cultures, customs and languages. In present-day Australia these groups are further divided into local communities.[57]

The elemental system use in Medieval alchemy be develop primarily by the Arabian alchemist Jābir ibn Hayyān and root in the classical elements of Greek tradition.[ 14] His system consist of the four Aristotelian elements of air, earth, fire, and water in addition to two philosophical elements: sulphur, characterize the principle of combustibility; `` the stone which burns'', and mercury, characterize the principle of metallic properties. They be see by early alchemists as idealized expressions of irreducibile components of the universe[ 15] and be of larger consideration within philosophical alchemy.

A series of international crises strain the League to its limits, the earliest be the invasion of Manchuria by Japan and the Abyssinian crisis of 1935/36 in which Italy invade Abyssinia, one of the only free African nations at that time. The League try to enforce economic sanctions upon Italy, but to no avail. The incident highlight French and British weakness, exemplify by their reluctance to alienate Italy and lose her as their ally. The limited actions take by the Western powers push Mussolini's Italy towards alliance with Hitler's Germany anyway. The Abyssinian war show Hitler how weak the League be and encourage the remilitarization of the Rhineland in flagrant disregard of the Treaty of Versailles. This be the first in a series of provocative acts culminate in the invasion of Poland in September 1939 and the beginning of the Second World War.

Although there be disagreement as to whether the dynasty actually exist, there be some archaeological evidence point to its possible existence. Writing in the late 2nd century BC, Sima Qian date the founding of the Xia dynasty to around 2200 BC, but this date have not be corroborate. Most archaeologists now connect the Xia to excavations at Erlitou in central Henan province,[ 23] where a bronze smelter from around 2000 BC be unearth. Early markings from this period find on pottery and shells be think to be ancestral to modern Chinese characters.[ 24] With few clear records match the Shang oracle bones or the Zhou bronze vessel writings, the Xia era remain poorly understood.

Students in the twelfth-century be very proud of the master whom they study under. They be not very concerned with tell others the place or region where they receive their education. Even now when scholars cite schools with distinctive doctrines, they use group names to describe the school rather than its geographical location. Those who study under Robert of Melun be call the Meludinenses. These people do not study in Melun, but in Paris, and be give the group name of their master. Citizens in the twelfth-century become very interested in learn the rare and difficult skills masters could provide.[ 41]

In parallel Hillary's team have set up Scott Base – which be to be Fuchs' final destination – on the opposite side of the continent at McMurdo Sound on the Ross Sea. Using three convert Massey Ferguson TE20 tractors[ 58] and one Weasel( abandon part-way), Hillary and his three men( Ron Balham, Peter Mulgrew and Murray Ellis), be responsible for route-finding and lay a line of supply depots up the Skelton Glacier and across the Polar Plateau on towards the South Pole, for the use of Fuchs on the final leg of his journey. Other members of Hillary's team carry out geological surveys around the Ross Sea and Victoria Land areas.

In the Eastern Empire the slow infiltration of the Balkans by the Slavs added a further difficulty for Justinian's successors. It began gradually, but by the late 540s Slavic tribes were in Thrace and Illyrium, and had defeated an imperial army near Adrianople in 551. In the 560s the Avars began to expand from their base on the north bank of the Danube; by the end of the 6th century they were the dominant power in Central Europe and routinely able to force the eastern emperors to pay tribute. They remained a strong power until 796.[62]

The Roman Empire underwent considerable social, cultural and organizational change starting with reign of Diocletian, who began the custom of splitting the Empire into Eastern and Western halves ruled by multiple emperors. Beginning with Constantine the Great the Empire was Christianized, and a new capital founded at Constantinople. Migrations of Germanic tribes disrupted Roman rule from the late 4th century onwards, culminating in the eventual collapse of the Empire in the West in 476, replaced by the so-called barbarian kingdoms. The resultant cultural fusion of Greco-Roman, Germanic and Christian traditions formed the cultural foundations of Europe.

The Viking voyages did not become common knowledge in the Old World, and Europeans remained ignorant of the existence of the Americas, until 1492. As part of a general age of discovery, Genoese sailor Christopher Columbus proposed a voyage west from Europe to find a shorter route to Asia. He eventually received the backing of Isabella I and Ferdinand II, Queen and King of newly united Spain. In 1492 Columbus reached land in the Bahamas.

Deng Xiaoping be the Paramount Leader of China from 1978 to 1992, although he never become the head of the party or state, and his influence within the Party lead the country to significant economic reforms. The Communist Party subsequently loosen governmental control over citizens' personal lives and the communes be disband with many peasants receive multiple land leases, which greatly increase incentives and agricultural production. This turn of events mark China's transition from a planned economy to a mixed economy with an increasingly open market environment, a system term by some[ 55] as `` market socialism'', and officially by the Communist Party of China as `` Socialism with Chinese characteristics''. The PRC adopt its current constitution on 4 December 1982.

Mendeleev had such faith in the validity of the periodic law that he proposed changes to the generally accepted values for the atomic weight of a few elements and, in his version of the periodic table of 1871, predicted the locations within the table of unknown elements together with their properties. He even predicted the likely properties of three yet-to-be-discovered elements, which he called ekaboron (Eb), ekaaluminium (Ea), and ekasilicon (Es), which proved to be good predictors of the properties of scandium, gallium, and germanium, respectively, which each fill the spot in the periodic table assigned by Mendeleev.

Classical antiquity be a broad term for a long period of cultural history center around the Mediterranean Sea, which begin roughly with the earliest-recorded Greek poetry of Homer( 9th century BC), and continue through the rise of Christianity and the fall of the Western Roman Empire( 5th century AD), end in the dissolution of classical culture with the close of Late Antiquity.

Military technology is the application of technology for use in warfare. It comprises the kinds of technology that are distinctly military in nature and not civilian in application, usually because they lack useful or legal civilian applications, or are dangerous to use without appropriate military training.

Among the earliest inventions be the abacus, the public toilet, and the `` shadow clock''.[ 29] Joseph Needham note the `` Four Great Inventions'' of China as among some of the most important technological advances; these be the compass, gunpowder, papermaking, and printing, which be later know in Europe by the end of the Middle Ages. The Tang dynasty( AD 618- 906) in particular be a time of great innovation.[ 29] A good deal of exchange occur between Western and Chinese discoveries up to the Qing dynasty.

In the 5th to 15th centuries, scientific progress occurred in the Muslim world. Many classic works in Latin and Greek were translated into Arabic. Ibn Sīnā (980–1037), known as "Avicenna", was a polymath from Bukhara (now in present-day Uzbekistan) responsible for important contributions to physics, optics, philosophy and medicine. He is most famous for writing The Canon of Medicine, a text that was used to teach student doctors in Europe until the 1600s.

The struggle between the Arabs and the Jews in Palestine culminate in the 1947 United Nations plan to partition Palestine. This plan attempt to create an Arab state and a Jewish state in the narrow space between the Jordan River and the Mediterranean. While the Jewish leaders accept it, the Arab leaders reject this plan.

From 613 to 630, Muhammad spread the faith of Islam in the Arabian desert, culminating in his victory at Mecca. He then unified the tribes into an Islamic Empire, ruled by a religious and political leader, the caliph. They would proceed to conquer the Sassanids, and modern-day Syria, Palestine, Egypt, and Libya.[12] An Arabic navy was created that soon dominated the Mediterranean, crippled the Byzantine Empire, and put it under siege for centuries to come.[13] Issues in deciding the caliphs to succeed Muhammad led to the Ridda wars and eventually the Sunni-Shia split, two different sects of Islam; the Sunni eventually became dominant and established the Umayyad Caliphate.[13]

By 1942, neighbour Burma be invade by Japan, which by then have already capture the Indian territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands. Japan give nominal control of the islands to the Provisional Government of Free India on 21 October 1943, and in the following March, the Indian National Army with the help of Japan cross into India and advance as far as Kohima in Nagaland. This advance on the mainland of South Asia reach its farthest point on India territory, retreat from the Battle of Kohima in June and from that of Imphal on 3 July 1944.

With Pierre-Simon Laplace, Lavoisier use a calorimeter to estimate the heat evolve per unit of carbon dioxide produce. They find the same ratio for a flame and animals, indicate that animals produce energy by a type of combustion. Lavoisier believe in the radical theory, believe that radicals, which function as a single group in a chemical reaction, would combine with oxygen in reactions. He believe all acids contain oxygen. He also discover that diamond be a crystalline form of carbon.

The transition to industrialisation was not without difficulty. For example, a group of English workers known as Luddites formed to protest against industrialisation and sometimes sabotaged factories.

The oldest legislative body in Australia, the New South Wales Legislative Council, be create in 1825 as an appoint body to advise the Governor of New South Wales. William Wentworth establish the Australian Patriotic Association( Australia's first political party) in 1835 to demand democratic government for New South Wales. The reformist attorney general, John Plunkett, seek to apply Enlightenment principles to governance in the colony, pursue the establishment of equality before the law, first by extend jury rights to emancipists, then by extend legal protections to convicts, assign servants and Aborigines. Plunkett twice charge the colonist perpetrators of the Myall Creek massacre of Aborigines with murder, result in a conviction and his landmark Church Act of 1836 disestablish the Church of England and establish legal equality between Anglicans, Catholics, Presbyterians and later Methodists.[ 202]

The geographers of ancient India put forward theories regard the origin of the earth. They theorize that the earth be form by the solidification of gaseous matter and that the earth's crust be compose of hard rocks( sila), clay( bhumih) and sand( asma).[ 18] Theories be also propound to explain earthquakes( bhukamp) and it be assume that earth, air and water combine to cause earthquakes.[ 18] The Arthashastra, a compendium by Kautilya( also know as Chanakya) contain a range of geographical and statistical information about the various regions of India.[ 16] The composers of the Puranas divide the known world into seven continents of dwipas, Jambu Dwipa, Krauncha Dwipa, Kusha Dwipa, Plaksha Dwipa, Pushkara Dwipa, Shaka Dwipa and Shalmali Dwipa. Descriptions be provide for the climate and geography of each of the dwipas.[ 18]

The Olmec civilization developed and flourished at such sites as La Venta and San Lorenzo Tenochtitlán. The Zapotec civilization arose in the Valley of Oaxaca, the Teotihuacan civilization arose in the Valley of Mexico, and the Maya civilization began to develop in the Isthmus of Tehuantepec in modern-day Chiapas, later expanding into Guatemala and the Yucatán Peninsula.[2][3][4]

Among the best-known expressions of Olmec culture be giant stone heads, sculpture monoliths up to three metres in height and several tons in weight. These feats of Olmec stonecutting be especially impressive when one consider that Mesoamericans lack iron tools and that the heads be at sites dozens of kilometers from the quarries where their basalt be mine. The function of these monuments be unknown. Some authors propose that they be commemorative monuments for notable players of the ballgame, and others that they be images of the Olmec govern elite.

Around 1785 BC, as the power of the Middle Kingdom pharaohs weaken, a Western Asian people call the Hyksos have already settle in the Eastern Delta town of Avaris, seize control of Egypt, and force the central government to retreat to Thebes. The pharaoh be treat as a vassal and expect to pay tribute.[ 42] The Hyksos( `` foreign rulers'') retain Egyptian models of government and identify as pharaohs, thus integrate Egyptian elements into their culture. They and other invaders introduce new tools of warfare into Egypt, most notably the composite bow and the horse-drawn chariot.[ 43]

English be a pluricentric language, which mean that no one national authority set the standard for use of the language.[ 87][ 88][ 89][ 90] But English be not a divided language,[ 91] despite a long-standing joke originally attribute to George Bernard Shaw that the United Kingdom and the United States be `` two countries separate by a common language''.[ 92] Spoken English, for example English use in broadcasting, generally follow national pronunciation standards that be also establish by custom rather than by regulation. International broadcasters be usually identifiable as come from one country rather than another through their accents,[ 93] but newsreader scripts be also compose largely in international standard write English. The norms of standard write English be maintain purely by the consensus of educate English-speakers around the world, without any oversight by any government or international organisation.[ 94] American listeners generally readily understand most British broadcasting, and British listeners readily understand most American broadcasting. Most English speakers around the world can understand radio programmes, television programmes, and films from many parts of the English-speaking world.[ 95] Both standard and nonstandard varieties of English can include both formal or informal styles, distinguish by word choice and syntax and use both technical and non-technical registers.[ 96]
Sculpture, paintings and stained glass windows were vital educational media through which Biblical themes and the lives of the saints were taught to illiterate viewers.[45]

The problem of the transitions in archaeology be a branch of the general philosophic continuity problem, which examine how discrete objects of any sort that be contiguous in any way can be presume to have a relationship of any sort. In archaeology, the relationship be one of causality. If Period B can be presume to descend from Period A, there must be a boundary between A and B, the A–B boundary. The problem be in the nature of this boundary. If there be no distinct boundary, then the population of A suddenly stop use the customs characteristic of A and suddenly start use those of B, an unlikely scenario in the process of evolution. More realistically, a distinct border period, the A/B transition, exist, in which the customs of A be gradually drop and those of B acquire. If transitions do not exist, then there be no proof of any continuity between A and B.[ citation need]

The multiple names result from multiple recognitions of the period. Originally, the term `` Bronze Age'' meant that either copper or bronze be be use as the chief hard substance for the manufacture of tools and weapons. In 1881, John Evans, recognize that the use of copper often precede the use of bronze, distinguish between a transitional Copper Age and the Bronze Age proper. He do not include the transitional period in the tripartite system of Early, Middle and Late Bronze Age but place it at the begin outside of it. He do not, however, present it as a fourth age but instead choose to retain the traditional three-age system.[ citation need]

Most parts of Europe had active and well-differentiated musical traditions by late in the century. In England, composers such as Thomas Tallis and William Byrd wrote sacred music in a style similar to that written on the continent, while an active group of home-grown madrigalists adapted the Italian form for English tastes: famous composers included Thomas Morley, John Wilbye and Thomas Weelkes. Spain developed instrumental and vocal styles of its own, with Tomás Luis de Victoria writing refined music similar to that of Palestrina, and numerous other composers writing for the new guitar. Germany cultivated polyphonic forms built on the Protestant chorales, which replaced the Roman Catholic Gregorian Chant as a basis for sacred music, and imported the style of the Venetian school (the appearance of which defined the start of the Baroque era there). In addition, German composers wrote enormous amounts of organ music, establishing the basis for the later Baroque organ style which culminated in the work of J.S. Bach. France developed a unique style of musical diction known as musique mesurée, used in secular chansons, with composers such as Guillaume Costeley and Claude Le Jeune prominent in the movement.
Unlike the Bengal School where'copying' be the norm of teaching, the Madras School flourishes on'creating' new styles, arguments and trends.

Once again Canada find itself at war before her neighbors, however even Canadian contributions be slight before the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor. The entry of the United States into the war help to tip the balance in favor of the allies. On August 19, 1942, a force of some 6000, largely Canadian, infantry be land near the French channel port of Dieppe. The German defenders under General von Rundstedt destroy the invaders. 907 Canadians be kill and almost 2,500 capture( many wound). Lessons learn in this abortive raid be put to good use 2 years later in the successful Normandy invasion.

From the mid-first century AD, Christianity take root in Egypt and it be originally see as another cult that could be accept. However, it be an uncompromising religion that seek to win converts from Egyptian Religion and Greco-Roman religion and threaten popular religious traditions. This lead to the persecution of converts to Christianity, culminate in the great purges of Diocletian start in 303, but eventually Christianity win out.[ 84] In 391 the Christian Emperor Theodosius introduce legislation that ban pagan rites and close temples.[ 85] Alexandria become the scene of great anti-pagan riots with public and private religious imagery destroyed.[ 86] As a consequence, Egypt's native religious culture be continually in decline. While the native population certainly continue to speak their language, the ability to read hieroglyphic write slowly disappear as the role of the Egyptian temple priests and priestesses diminish. The temples themselves be sometimes convert to churches or abandon to the desert.[ 87]

The European economic center shift from the Mediterranean to Western Europe. The city of Antwerp, part of the Duchy of Brabant, become `` the center of the entire international economy,[ 153] and the richest city in Europe at this time.[ 154] Centered in Antwerp first and then in Amsterdam, `` Dutch Golden Age'' be tightly link to the Age of Discovery. Francesco Guicciardini, a Venetian envoy, state that hundreds of ships would pass Antwerp in a day, and 2,000 carts enter the city each week. Portuguese ships lade with pepper and cinnamon would unload their cargo. With many foreign merchants resident in the city and govern by an oligarchy of banker-aristocrats forbidden to engage in trade, the economy of Antwerp be foreigner-controlled, which make the city very international, with merchants and traders from Venice, Ragusa, Spain and Portugal and a policy of toleration, which attract a large Orthodox Jewish community. The city experience three booms during its golden age, the first base on the pepper market, a second launch by New World silver come from Seville( end with the bankruptcy of Spain in 1557), and a third boom, after the Treaty of Cateau-Cambresis, in 1559, base on the textiles industry.

The Castellieri culture developed in Istria during the Middle Bronze Age. It lasted for more than a millennium, from the 15th century BC until the Roman conquest in the 3rd century BC. It takes its name from the fortified boroughs (Castellieri, Friulian cjastelir) that characterized the culture.

The early Roman army (c. 500 BC) was, like those of other contemporary city-states influenced by Greek civilization, a citizen militia that practiced hoplite tactics. It was small (the population of free men of military age was then about 9,000) and organized in five classes (in parallel to the comitia centuriata, the body of citizens organized politically), with three providing hoplites and two providing light infantry. The early Roman army was tactically limited and its stance during this period was essentially defensive.[184]

The consequence of this complex orthographic history be that learn to read can be challenge in English. It can take longer for school pupils to become independently fluent readers of English than of many other languages, include Italian, Spanish, or German.[ 227] Nonetheless, there be an advantage for learners of English reading in learn the specific sound-symbol regularities that occur in the standard English spellings of commonly use words.[ 222] Such instruction greatly reduce the risk of children experience read difficulties in English.[ 228][ 229] Making primary school teachers more aware of the primacy of morpheme representation in English may help learners learn more efficiently to read and write English.[ 230]

Initially, Rome was ruled by kings, who were elected from each of Rome's major tribes in turn.[179] The exact nature of the king's power is uncertain. He may have held near-absolute power, or may also have merely been the chief executive of the Senate and the people. At least in military matters, the king's authority (Imperium) was likely absolute. He was also the head of the state religion. In addition to the authority of the King, there were three administrative assemblies: the Senate, which acted as an advisory body for the King; the Comitia Curiata, which could endorse and ratify laws suggested by the King; and the Comitia Calata, which was an assembly of the priestly college that could assemble the people to bear witness to certain acts, hear proclamations, and declare the feast and holiday schedule for the next month.

The causes of World War I included many factors, including the conflicts and antagonisms of the four decades leading up to the war. The Triple Entente was the name given to the loose alignment between the United Kingdom, France, and Russia after the signing of the Anglo-Russian Entente in 1907. The alignment of the three powers, supplemented by various agreements with Japan, the United States, and Spain, constituted a powerful counterweight to the Triple Alliance of Germany, Austria-Hungary, and Italy, the third having concluded an additional secret agreement with France effectively nullifying her Alliance commitments. Militarism, alliances, imperialism, and nationalism played major roles in the conflict. The immediate origins of the war lay in the decisions taken by statesmen and generals during the July Crisis of 1914, the spark (or casus belli) for which was the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria.

On top of the supply of money, Keynes identify the propensity to consume, inducement to invest, marginal efficiency of capital, liquidity preference, and multiplier effect as variables which determine the level of the economy's output, employment, and price levels. Much of this esoteric terminology be invent by Keynes especially for his General Theory. Keynes argue that if savings be be withhold from investment in financial markets, total spending falls, lead to reduce incomes and unemployment, which reduce savings again. This continue until the desire to save becomes equal to the desire to invest, which mean a new `` equilibrium'' be reach and the spending decline halts. This new `` equilibrium'' be a depression, where people be invest less, have less to save and less to spend.

Software product lines, aka product family engineering, be a systematic way to produce families of software systems, instead of create a succession of completely individual products. This method emphasize extensive, systematic, formal code reuse, to try to industrialize the software development process.

Egypt be invade or conquer by a succession of foreign powers, such as the Canaanites/Hyksos, Libyans, the Nubians, the Assyrians, Babylonians, the Achaemenid Persians, and the Macedonians in the Third Intermediate Period and the Late Period of Egypt. This Greek Ptolemaic Kingdom rule Egypt until 30 BC, when, under Cleopatra, it fell to the Roman Empire and become a Roman province.[ 3]

Spain sponsor a major exploration lead by Christopher Columbus in 1492; it quickly lead to extensive European colonization of the Americas. Columbus come at a time in which many technical developments in sail techniques and communication make it possible to report his voyages easily and to spread word of them throughout western Europe. Before the Muslim expeditions into the Indian subcontinent, much of North and West India was ruled by Rajput dynasties. The Rajputs and the south Indian Chalukya dynasty were successful in containing Arab Muslim expansion during the Caliphate campaigns in India; but later, Central Asian Muslim Turks were able to break through the Rajput defence into the Northern Indian heartland. However, the Rajputs held out against the Muslim Turkic empires for several centuries. They earned a reputation of fighting battles obeying a code of chivalrous conduct rooted in a strong adherence to tradition and Chi.[267]

During the 1980s, audiences began increasingly watching films on their home VCRs. Yet the formation of a new field, genetic engineering, would soon bring biotechnology to the forefront of science in society, and the intimate relationship between the scientific community, the public, and the government would ensue. By as early as 1978, with the development of synthetic human insulin, Lederberg's claims would prove valid, and the biotechnology industry grow rapidly. Each new scientific advance become a media event design to capture public support, and by the 1980s, biotechnology grow into a promising real industry. Roman domes permitted construction of vaulted ceilings and enable huge cover public spaces such as the public baths like Baths of Diocletian or the monumental Pantheon in the city of Rome.

John Maynard Keynes( 1883–1946) be bear in Cambridge, educate at Eton, and supervise by both A. C. Pigou and Alfred Marshall at Cambridge University. He begin his career as a lecturer before work for the British government during the Great War, rise to be the British government's financial representative at the Versailles Conference, where he profoundly disagree with the decisions make. His observations be lay out in his book The Economic Consequences of the Peace[ 76]( 1919), where he document his outrage at the collapse of American adherence to the Fourteen Points[ 77] and the mood of vindictiveness that prevail towards Germany.,[ 78] and he resign from the conference, use extensive economic data provide by the conference records to argue that if the victors force war reparations to be pay by the defeated Axis, then a world financial crisis would ensue, lead to a second world war.[ 79] Keynes finish his treatise by advocate, first, a reduction in reparation payments by Germany to a realistically manageable level, increase intra-governmental management of continental coal production and a free trade union through the League of Nations;[ 80] second, an arrangement to set off debt repayments between the Allied countries;[ 81] third, complete reform of international currency exchange and an international loan fund;[ 82] and fourth, a reconciliation of trade relations with Russia and Eastern Europe.[ 83]

The notion of "prehistory" began to surface during the Enlightenment in the work of antiquarians who used the word 'primitive' to describe societies that existed before written records.[5] The first use of the word prehistory in English, however, occurred in the Foreign Quarterly Review in 1836.[6]

The three metallic principles: sulphur to flammability or combustion, mercury to volatility and stability, and salt to solidity. become the tria prima of the Swiss alchemist Paracelsus. Paracelsus saw these principles as fundamental and justify them by recourse to the description of how wood burns in fire. Smoke describe the volatility( the mercurial principle), the heat-giving flames describe flammability( sulphur), and the remnant ash describe solidity( salt).[ 16]

Experimentation be not the only approach to psychology in the German-speaking world at this time. Starting in the 1890s, employ the case study technique, the Viennese physician Sigmund Freud develop and apply the methods of hypnosis, free association, and dream interpretation to reveal putatively unconscious beliefs and desires that he argue be the underlying causes of his patients' `` hysteria.'' He dub this approach psychoanalysis. Freudian psychoanalysis be particularly notable for the emphasis it place on the course of an individual's sexual development in pathogenesis. Psychoanalytic concepts have have a strong and lasting influence on Western culture, particularly on the arts. Although its scientific contribution be still a matter of debate, both Freudian and Jungian psychology reveal the existence of compartmentalized thinking, in which some behavior and thoughts be hide from consciousness – yet operative as part of the complete personality. Hidden agendas, a bad conscience, or a sense of guilt, be examples of the existence of mental processes in which the individual be not conscious, through choice or lack of understanding, of some aspects of their personality and subsequent behavior.

The ancient Egyptians use donkeys and oxen as beasts of burden, and they be responsible for plow the fields and trample seed into the soil. The slaughter of a fattened ox be also a central part of an offering ritual.[ 107] Horses be introduce by the Hyksos in the Second Intermediate Period, and the camel, although know from the New Kingdom, be not use as a beast of burden until the Late Period. There be also evidence to suggest that elephants be briefly utilize in the Late Period, but largely abandon due to lack of graze land.[ 107] Dogs, cats and monkeys be common family pets, while more exotic pets import from the heart of Africa, such as lions, be reserve for royalty. Herodotus observe that the Egyptians be the only people to keep their animals with them in their houses.[ 106] During the Predynastic and Late periods, the worship of the gods in their animal form be extremely popular, such as the cat goddess Bastet and the ibis god Thoth, and these animals be breed in large numbers on farms for the purpose of ritual sacrifice.[ 109]

By the mid 20th century, in principle, the integration of physics and chemistry be extensive, with chemical properties explain as the result of the electronic structure of the atom; Linus Pauling's book on The Nature of the Chemical Bond use the principles of quantum mechanics to deduce bond angles in ever-more complicated molecules. However, though some principles deduce from quantum mechanics be able to predict qualitatively some chemical features for biologically relevant molecules, they be, till the end of the 20th century, more a collection of rules, observations, and recipes than rigorous ab initio quantitative methods.[ citation need]

It was the discovery of the touchstone which led the way for metal-based commodity money and coinage. Any soft metal can be tested for purity on a touchstone, allowing one to quickly calculate the total content of a particular metal in a lump. Gold is a soft metal, which is also hard to come by, dense, and storable. As a result, monetary gold spread very quickly from Asia Minor, where it first gained wide usage, to the entire world.

For practitioners in Europe, alchemy become an intellectual pursuit after early Arabic alchemy become available through Latin translation, and over time, they improve. Paracelsus( 1493–1541), for example, reject the 4-elemental theory and with only a vague understanding of his chemicals and medicines, form a hybrid of alchemy and science in what be to be call iatrochemistry. Paracelsus be not perfect in make his experiments truly scientific. For example, as an extension of his theory that new compounds could be make by combine mercury with sulfur, he once make what he think be `` oil of sulfur''. This be actually dimethyl ether, which have neither mercury nor sulfur.[ citation need]

In ancient China, biological topics can be found dispersed across several different disciplines, including the work of herbologists, physicians, alchemists, and philosophers. The Taoist tradition of Chinese alchemy, for example, can be considered part of the life sciences due to its emphasis on health (with the ultimate goal being the elixir of life). The system of classical Chinese medicine usually revolved around the theory of yin and yang, and the five phases.[8] Taoist philosophers, such as Zhuangzi in the 4th century BCE, also expressed ideas related to evolution, such as denying the fixity of biological species and speculating that species had developed differing attributes in response to differing environments.[9]

In the United States, a scientific revolution in agriculture began with the Hatch Act of 1887, which used the term "agricultural science". The Hatch Act was driven by farmers' interest in knowing the constituents of early artificial fertilizer. Later on, the Smith-Hughes Act of 1917 shifted agricultural education back to its vocational roots, but the scientific foundation had been built.[4] After 1906, public expenditures on agricultural research in the US exceeded private expenditures for the next 44 years.[5]

Shortly after Columbus's return from what would later be called the "West Indies", a division of influence became necessary to avoid conflict between the Spanish and Portuguese.[63] On 4 May 1493, two months after Columbus's arrival, the Catholic Monarchs received a bull (Inter caetera) from Pope Alexander VI stating that all lands west and south of a pole-to-pole line 100 leagues west and south of the Azores or the Cape Verde Islands should belong to Castile and, later, all mainlands and islands then belonging to India. It did not mention Portugal, which could not claim newly discovered lands east of the line.

From the 1880s to 1914, the European powers expand their control across the African continent, compete with each other for Africa’s land and resources. Great Britain control various colonial holdings in East Africa that span the length of the African continent from Egypt in the north to South Africa. The French gained major ground in West Africa, and the Portuguese held colonies in southern Africa. Germany, Italy, and Spain establish a small number of colonies at various points throughout the continent, which include German East Africa( Tanganyika) and German Southwest Africa for Germany, Eritrea and Libya for Italy, and the Canary Islands and Rio de Oro in northwestern Africa for Spain. Finally, for King Leopold( rule from 1865–1909), there be the large “piece of that great African cake” know as the Congo, which, unfortunately for the native Congolese, become his personal fiefdom to do with as he please in Central Africa. By 1914, almost the entire continent be under European control. Liberia, which be settle by freed American slaves in the 1820s, and Abyssinia( Ethiopia) in eastern Africa be the last remaining independent African states.( John Merriman, A History of Modern Europe, Volume Two: From the French Revolution to the Present, Third Edition( New York: W. W. Norton& Company, 2010), pp. 819–859).

Einstein argue that the speed of light be a constant in all inertial reference frames and that electromagnetic laws should remain valid independent of reference frame—assertions which render the ether `` superfluous'' to physical theory, and that hold that observations of time and length vary relative to how the observer be move with respect to the object be measure( what come to be call the `` special theory of relativity''). It also follow that mass and energy be interchangeable quantities accord to the equation E=mc2. In another paper publish the same year, Einstein assert that electromagnetic radiation be transmit in discrete quantities( `` quanta''), accord to a constant that the theoretical physicist Max Planck have posit in 1900 to arrive at an accurate theory for the distribution of blackbody radiation—an assumption that explain the strange properties of the photoelectric effect.

Aristotle introduce what may be call a scientific method.[ 16][ need quotation to verify] His demonstration method be find in Posterior Analytics. He provide another of the ingredients of scientific tradition: empiricism. For Aristotle, universal truths can be know from particular things via induction. To some extent then, Aristotle reconcile abstract think with observation, although it would be a mistake to imply that Aristotelian science be empirical in form. Indeed, Aristotle do not accept that knowledge acquire by induction could rightly be count as scientific knowledge. Nevertheless, induction be for him a necessary preliminary to the main business of scientific enquiry, provide the primary premises require for scientific demonstrations.

Later in the 1960s and 1970s, Edmund Leach and his students Mary Douglas and Nur Yalman, among others, introduced French structuralism in the style of Lévi-Strauss; while British anthropology has continued to emphasize social organization and economics over purely symbolic or literary topics, differences among British, French, and American sociocultural anthropologies have diminished with increasing dialogue and borrowing of both theory and methods. Dissenters find themselves bar or discourage from almost all public offices, as well as education at England's only two universities at the time( although dissenters be still free to study at Scotland's four universities). The atomic theory of matter had been proposed again in the early 19th century by the chemist John Dalton and became one of the hypotheses of the kinetic-molecular theory of gases developed by Clausius and James Clerk Maxwell to explain the laws of thermodynamics. The kinetic theory in turn led to the statistical mechanics of Ludwig Boltzmann (1844–1906) and Josiah Willard Gibbs (1839–1903), which held that energy (including heat) was a measure of the speed of particles. Interrelating the statistical likelihood of certain states of organization of these particles with the energy of those states, Clausius reinterpreted the dissipation of energy to be the statistical tendency of molecular configurations to pass toward increasingly likely, increasingly disorganized states (coining the term "entropy" to describe the disorganization of a state). The statistical versus absolute interpretations of the second law of thermodynamics set up a dispute that would last for several decades (producing arguments such as "Maxwell's demon"), and that would not be held to be definitively resolved until the behavior of atoms was firmly established in the early 20th century.[42][43] In 1902, James Jeans found the length scale required for gravitational perturbations to grow in a static nearly homogeneous medium.

The emergence of Dutch maritime power be swift and remarkable: for years Dutch sailors have participate in Portuguese voyages to the east, as able seafarers and keen mapmakers. In 1592, Cornelis de Houtman be send by Dutch merchants to Lisbon, to gather as much information as he could about the Spice Islands. In 1595, merchant and explorer Jan Huyghen van Linschoten, have travel widely in the Indian Ocean at the service of the Portuguese, publish a travel report in Amsterdam, the `` Reys-gheschrift vande navigatien der Portugaloysers in Orienten''( `` Report of a journey through the navigations of the Portuguese in the East'').[ 117] This include vast directions on how to navigate between Portugal and the East Indies and to Japan. That same year Houtman follow this directions in the Dutch first exploratory travel that discover a new sea route, sail directly from Madagascar to Sunda Strait in Indonesia and sign a treaty with the Banten Sultan.

In the 1770s-1850s Paris become a world center of medical research and teaching. In 609 BC Necho II go to war with Babylonia, the Chaldeans, the Medians and the Scythians in an attempt to save Assyria, which after a brutal civil war be be overrun by this coalition of powers. However, the attempt to save Egypt's former masters fail. The Egyptians delay intervene too long, and Nineveh have already fall and King Sin-shar-ishkun be dead by the time Necho II send his armies northwards. However, Necho easily brush aside the Israelite army under King Josiah but he and the Assyrians then lose a battle at Harran to the Babylonians, Medes and Scythians. Necho II and Ashur-uballit II of Assyria be finally defeat at Carchemish in Aramea( modern Syria) in 605 BC. The Egyptians remain in the area for some decades, struggle with the Babylonian kings Nabopolassar and Nebuchadnezzar II for control of portions of the former Assyrian Empire in The Levant. However, they be eventually drive back into Egypt, and Nebuchadnezzar II even briefly invade Egypt itself in 567 BC.[ 70] The Saite kings base in the new capital of Sais witness a brief but spirited resurgence in the economy and culture, but in 525 BC, the powerful Persians, lead by Cambyses II, begin their conquest of Egypt, eventually capture the pharaoh Psamtik III at the battle of Pelusium. Cambyses II then assume the formal title of pharaoh, but rule Egypt from his home of Susa in Persia( modern Iran), leave Egypt under the control of a satrapy. A few temporarily successful revolts against the Persians mark the fifth century BC, but Egypt be never able to permanently overthrow the Persians.[ 75]
During the French Revolution, the National Assembly, which existed from June 17 to July 9 of 1789, was a transitional body between the Estates-General and the National Constituent Assembly.

The new Western philosophical foundations that emerged from the pursuit of reason during the Enlightenment era helped pave the way for policies that emphasized a need for a separation of church and state. Principles similar to those that dominated the material sciences could be applied to society as a whole, originating the social sciences. Politics could be studied in a laboratory as it were, the social milieu. In 1787, Alexander Hamilton wrote: "...The science of politics like most other sciences has received great improvement." (The Federalist Papers Number 9 and 51). Both the marquis d'Argenson and the abbé de Saint-Pierre described politics as a science; d'Argenson was a philosopher and de Saint-Pierre an allied reformer of the enlightenment.[4]

In 1907, a Central American Court of Justice was created. On December 13, 1960, Guatemala, El Salvador, Honduras, and Nicaragua established the Central American Common Market ("CACM"). Costa Rica, because of its relative economic prosperity and political stability, chose not to participate in the CACM. The goals for the CACM were to create greater political unification and success of import substitution industrialization policies. The project was an immediate economic success, but was abandoned after the 1969 "Football War" between El Salvador and Honduras. A Central American Parliament has operated, as a purely advisory body, since 1991. Costa Rica has repeatedly declined invitations to join the regional parliament, which seats deputies from the four other former members of the Union, as well as from Panama and the Dominican Republic.

Internalist histories of science often focus on the rational reconstruction of scientific ideas and consider the development of these ideas wholly within the scientific world. Although internalist histories of modern science tend to emphasize the norms of modern science, internalist histories can also consider the different systems of thought underlying the development of Babylonian astronomy or Medieval impetus theory

At the turn of the 20th century, the violent Boxer Rebellion oppose foreign influence in Northern China, and attack Chinese Christians and missionaries. When Boxers enter Beijing, the Qing government order all foreigners to leave. But instead the foreigners and many Chinese be besiege in the foreign legations quarter. The Eight-Nation Alliance send the Seymour Expedition of Japanese, Russian, Italian, German, French, American, and Austrian troops to relieve the siege. The Expedition be stop by the Boxers at the Battle of Langfang and force to retreat. Due to the Alliance's attack on the Dagu Forts, the Qing government in response side with the Boxers and declare war on the Alliance. There be fierce fighting at Tientsin. The Alliance form the second, much larger Gaselee Expedition and finally reach Beijing; the Qing government evacuate to Xi'an. The Boxer Protocol end the war.

The departure of the European powers from direct control of the region, the establishment of Israel, and the increase importance of the oil industry, mark the creation of the modern Middle East. Much literature remain religious in character, and although a great deal of it continue to be write in Latin, a new demand develop for saints' lives and other devotional tracts in the vernacular languages.[ 304] This be feed by the growth of the Devotio Moderna movement, most prominently in the formation of the Brethren of the Common Life, but also in the works of German mystics such as Meister Eckhart and Johannes Tauler( d. 1361).[ 306] Theatre also develop in the guise of miracle plays put on by the Church.[ 304] At the end of the period, the development of the print press in about 1450 lead to the establishment of publishing houses throughout Europe by 1500.[ 307]

Metal base coins have the advantage of carry their value within the coins themselves – on the other hand, they induce manipulations: the clipping of coins in the attempt to get and recycle the precious metal. A greater problem be the simultaneous co-existence of gold, silver and copper coins in Europe. English and Spanish traders value gold coins more than silver coins, as many of their neighbors do, with the effect that the English gold-based guinea coin begin to rise against the English silver base crown in the 1670s and 1680s. Consequently, silver be ultimately pull out of England for dubious amounts of gold come into the country at a rate no other European nation would share. In the 19th century the empire be internally stagnant and externally threaten by western powers. The defeat by the British Empire in the First Opium War( 1840) lead to the Treaty of Nanking( 1842), under which Hong Kong be cede to Britain and importation of opium( produce by British Empire territories) be allow. Subsequent military defeats and unequal treaties with other western powers continue even after the fall of the Qing dynasty.

Around the end of the 19th century and into the 20th century, the Meiji era was marked by the reign of the Meiji Emperor. During this time, Japan started its modernization and rose to world power status. This era name means "Enlightened Rule". In Japan, the Meiji Restoration started in the 1860s, marking the rapid modernization by the Japanese themselves along European lines. Much research has focused on the issues of discontinuity versus continuity with the previous Tokugawa Period.[68] In the 1960s younger Japanese scholars led by Irokawa Daikichi, reacted against the bureaucratic superstate, and began searching for the historic role of the common people . They avoided the elite, and focused not on political events but on social forces and attitudes. They rejected both Marxism and modernization theory as alien and confining. They stressed the importance of popular energies in the development of modern Japan. They enlarged history by using the methods of social history.[69] It was not until the beginning of the Meiji Era that the Japanese government began taking modernization seriously. Japan expanded its military production base by opening arsenals in various locations. The hyobusho (war office) was replaced with a War Department and a Naval Department. The samurai class suffered great disappointment the following years.

The invention of the first write systems be roughly contemporary in with the beginning of the Bronze Age in the late Neolithic of the late 4000 BC. The first writing system be generally believe to have be invent in pre-historic Sumer and develop by the late 3000's BC into cuneiform. Egyptian hieroglyphs, and the undeciphered Proto-Elamite writing system and Indus Valley script also date to this era, though a few scholars have question the Indus Valley script's status as a writing system.

Portugal's neighbour fellow Iberian rival, Castile, have begin to establish its rule over the Canary Islands, locate off the west African coast, in 1402, but then become distract by internal Iberian politics and the repelling of Islamic invasion attempts and raids through most of the 15th century. Only late in the century, follow the unification of the crowns of Castile and Aragon and the completion of the reconquista, do an emerge modern Spain become fully commit to the search for new trade routes overseas. The Crown of Aragon have be an important maritime potentate in the Mediterranean, control territories in eastern Spain, southwestern France, major islands like Sicily, Malta, and the Kingdom of Naples and Sardinia, with mainland possessions as far as Greece. In 1492 the joint rulers conquer the Moorish kingdom of Granada, which have be provide Castile with African goods through tribute, and decide to fund Christopher Columbus's expedition in the hope of bypass Portugal's monopoly on west African sea routes, to reach `` the Indies''( east and south Asia) by travel west.[ 59] Twice before, in 1485 and 1488, Columbus have present the project to king John II of Portugal, who reject it.

However, the prime example of reference works that systematize scientific knowledge in the age of Enlightenment be universal encyclopedias rather than technical dictionaries. It be the goal of universal encyclopedias to record all human knowledge in a comprehensive reference work.[ 166] The most well-known of these works be Denis Diderot and Jean le Rond d'Alembert's Encyclopédie, ou dictionnaire raisonné des sciences, des arts et des métiers. The work, which begin publication in 1751, be compose of thirty-five volumes and over 71 000 separate entries. A great number of the entries be dedicate to describe the sciences and crafts in detail, and provide intellectuals across Europe with a high-quality survey of human knowledge. In d'Alembert's Preliminary Discourse to the Encyclopedia of Diderot, the work's goal to record the extent of human knowledge in the arts and sciences be outline:

Until 1927, motion pictures be produce without sound. This era be refer to as the silent era of film. To enhance the viewers' experience, silent films be commonly accompany by live musicians in an orchestra, a theatre organ, and sometimes sound effects and even commentary speak by the showman or projectionist. In most countries, intertitles come to be use to provide dialogue and narration for the film, thus dispense with narrators, but in Japanese cinema human narration remain popular throughout the silent era. The technical problems be resolve by 1923.

Syrian bishop Jacob of Edessa( 633–708) adapt scientific material source from Aristotle, Theophrastus, Ptolemy and Basil to develop a carefully structured picture of the cosmos. He correct his sources and write more scientifically, whereas Basil’s Hexaemeron be theological in style.[ 40]

The manufactured gas industry begin in British cities in 1812–1820. The technique use produce highly toxic effluent that be dump into sewers and rivers. The gas companies be repeatedly sue in nuisance lawsuits. They usually lose and modify the worst practices. The City of London repeatedly indict gas companies in the 1820s for pollute the Thames and poison its fish. Finally, Parliament write company charters to regulate toxicity.[ 112] The industry reach the US around 1850 cause pollution and lawsuits.[ 113]

In the late 19th and early 20th centuries archaeologists work on the assumptions that a succession of Hominans and cultures prevail, that one replace another. Today the presence of multiple hominans live contemporaneously near each other for long periods be accept as proved true; moreover, by the time the previously assume `` earliest'' culture arrive in northern Europe, the rest of Africa and Eurasia have progress to the Middle and Upper Palaeolithic, so that across the earth all three be for a time contemporaneous. In any give region there be a progression from Oldowan to Acheulean, Lower to Upper, no doubt.
