The burial of the dead (which, until this period, had usually been communal) became more individual. For example, whereas in the Neolithic a large chambered cairn or long barrow housed the dead, Early Bronze Age people buried their dead in individual barrows (also commonly known and marked on modern British Ordnance Survey maps as tumuli), or sometimes in cists covered with cairns.

Homo neanderthalensis, with his Mousterian technology emerged, in areas from Europe to western Asia, after this and continued to be the dominant group of humans in Europe and Middle East up until 40000-28000 ybp. Peking man has also been dated to this period. During Eemian Stage humans probably (see f.e. Wolf Cave) spread where ever their technology and skills allowed, Sahara dried up forming a difficult area for peoples to cross.

The Qing dynasty (1644–1912) was founded after the fall of the Ming, the last Han Chinese dynasty, by the Manchus. The Manchus were formerly known as the Jurchens. When Beijing was captured by Li Zicheng's peasant rebels in 1644, the Chongzhen Emperor, the last Ming emperor, committed suicide. The Manchus then allied with former Ming general Wu Sangui and seized control of Beijing, which became the new capital of the Qing dynasty. The Manchus adopted the Confucian norms of traditional Chinese government in their rule of China proper. Schoppa, the editor of The Columbia Guide to Modern Chinese History argues, "A date around 1780 as the beginning of modern China is thus closer to what we know today as historical 'reality'. It also allows us to have a better baseline to understand the precipitous decline of the Chinese polity in the nineteenth and twentieth centuries."[41]

The Bito clan claim legitimacy by be descend from the Bachwezi clan, who be say to have rule the Empire of Kitara. However, very little be know about Kitara; some scholars even question its historical existence. Most founding leaders of the various polities in the lake region seem to have claim descent from the Bachwezi.[ 161] There be now 13 million Tara who be part of the second African loss,( Nafi and Uma be two losses).[ citation need]

The attack on Pearl Harbor[note 3] was a surprise military strike conducted by the Imperial Japanese Navy against the United States naval base at Pearl Harbor, Hawaii, on the morning of 7 December 1941 (8 December in Japan). The attack led to the United States' entry into World War II.

An American invention at the time be a device to scramble the telephone call between Winston Churchill and Franklin D. Roosevelt. This be call the Green Hornet system and work by insert noise into the signal. The noise be then extract at the receive end. This system be never break by the Germans.
The historians Josephus and Pliny the Elder write their works during Vespasian's reign. Vespasian be Josephus' sponsor and Pliny dedicate his Naturalis Historia to Titus, son of Vespasian.

The International style be a major architectural trend of the 1920s and 1930s. The term usually refer to the buildings and architects of the formative decades of modernism, before World War II. The term have its origin from the name of a book by Henry-Russell Hitchcock and Philip Johnson which identify, categorise and expand upon characteristics common to modernism across the world. As a result, the focus be more on the stylistic aspects of modernism. The basic design principles of the International Style thus constitute part of modernism.

In 1944 Hungarian-American mathematician John von Neumann and Oskar Morgenstern publish Theory of Games and Economic Behavior, found Game Theory, which be widely adopt by economists. In 1951 Princeton mathematician John Forbes Nash Jr. publish the article Non-Cooperative Games, become the first to define a Nash Equilibrium for non-zero-sum games.

The history of Greece during Classical Antiquity may be subdivide into five major periods.[ 7] The earliest of these be the Archaic period( c. 800 – c. 500 BC), in which artists make larger free-standing sculptures in stiff, hieratic poses with the dreamlike `` archaic smile''. The Archaic period be often take to end with the overthrow of the last tyrant of Athens and the start of Athenian Democracy in 508 BC. It be follow by the Classical period( c. 500 – 323 BC), characterize by a style which be consider by later observers to be exemplary, i.e., `` classical'', as show in the Parthenon, for instance. Politically, the Classical Period be dominate by Athens and the Delian League during the 5th century, but displace by Spartan hegemony during the early 4th century BC, before power shift to Thebes and the Boeotian League and finally to the League of Corinth lead by Macedon. This period saw the Greco-Persian Wars and the Rise of Macedon.

Wrought iron for smiths to forge into consumer goods be still make in finery forges, as it long have be. However, new processes be adopt in the ensue years. The first be refer to today as potting and stamping, but this be supersede by Henry Cort's puddling process. Cort develop two significant iron manufacturing processes: rolling in 1783 and puddle in 1784.[ 28] Rolling replace hammer for consolidate wrought iron and expel some of the dross. Rolling be 15 times faster than hammer with a trip hammer. Roller mills be first use for make sheets, but also be develop for roll structural shapes such as angles and rails.
The astronomy of East Asia begin in China. Solar term be complete in Warring States period. The knowledge of Chinese astronomy be introduce into East Asia.

Over the next few centuries, clarity be reach in the organization of sound units, and the stop consonants be organize in a 5x5 square( c. 800 BCE, Pratisakhyas), eventually lead to a systematic alphabet, Brāhmī, by the 3rd century BCE.

The modern period have be a period of significant development in the fields of science, politics, warfare, and technology. It have also be an age of discovery and globalization. During this time, the European powers and later their colonies, begin a political, economic, and cultural colonization of the rest of the world.

One of the basic requirements for a scientific community be the existence and approval of a political sponsor; in England, the Royal Society operate under the aegis of the monarchy; in the US, the National Academy of Sciences be found by Act of the United States Congress; etc. Otherwise, when the basic elements of knowledge be be formulate, the political rulers of the respective communities could choose to arbitrarily either support or disallow the nascent scientific communities. For example, Alhazen have to feign madness to avoid execution. The polymath Shen Kuo lose political support, and could not continue his studies until he come up with discoveries that show his worth to the political rulers. The admiral Zheng He could not continue his voyages of exploration after the emperors withdraw their support. Another famous example be the suppression of the work of Galileo, by the twentieth century, Galileo would be pardon.

The Niger Delta comprise numerous city-states with numerous forms of government. These city-states be protect by the waterways and thick vegetation of the delta. The region be transform by trade in the 17th century. The delta's city-states be comparable to those of the Swahili people in East Africa. Some, like Bonny, Kalabari, and Warri, have kings. Others, like Brass, be republics with small senates, and those at Cross River and Old Calabar be rule by merchants of the ekpe society. The ekpe society regulate trade and make rules for members know as house systems. Some of these houses, like the Pepples of Bonny, be well know in the Americas and Europe.[ 195]

In the 13th century, paper money become know in Europe through the accounts of travelers, such as Marco Polo and William of Rubruck.[ 88] Marco Polo's account of paper money during the Yuan Dynasty be the subject of a chapter of his book, The Travels of Marco Polo, title `` How the Great Kaan Causeth the Bark of Trees, Made into Something Like Paper, to Pass for Money All Over his Country. ``[ 89] In medieval Italy and Flanders, because of the insecurity and impracticality of transport large sums of money over long distances, money traders start use promissory notes. In the beginning these be personally register, but they soon become a write order to pay the amount to whoever have it in their possession.[ 90] These notes can be see as a predecessor to regular banknotes.[ 91] The first European banknotes be issue by Stockholms Banco, a predecessor of the Bank of Sweden, in 1661.[ 92] These replace the copper-plates be use instead as a means of payment,[ 93] although in 1664 the bank run out of coins to redeem notes and cease operating in the same year.

The era of the French Revolution and the subsequent Napoleonic wars was a difficult time for monarchs. Tsar Paul I of Russia was assassinated; King Louis XVI of France was executed, as was his Queen Marie Antoinette. Furthermore, kings Charles IV of Spain, Ferdinand VII of Spain and Gustav IV Adolf of Sweden were deposed as were ultimately the Emperor Napoleon and all of the relatives he had installed on various European thrones. King Frederick William III of Prussia and Emperor Francis II of Austria barely clung to their thrones. King George III of England lost the better part of his empire.[73]

Another legend, recorded by Greek historian Dionysius of Halicarnassus, says that Prince Aeneas led a group of Trojans on a sea voyage to found a new Troy, since the original was destroyed in the outcome of the Trojan War. After a long time in rough seas, they landed at the banks of the Tiber River. Not long after they landed, the men wanted to take to the sea again, but the women who were traveling with them did not want to leave. One woman, named Roma, suggested that the women burn the ships out at sea to prevent them from leaving. At first, the men were angry with Roma, but they soon realized that they were in the ideal place to settle. They named the settlement after the woman who torched their ships.[17]

The increase in wealth experience by Spain coincide with a major inflationary cycle both within Spain and Europe, know as the price revolution. Spain have amass large quantities of gold and silver from the New World.[ 162] In the 1520s large scale extraction of silver from Mexico's Guanajuato begin. With the opening of the silver mines in Zacatecas and Bolivia's Potosí in 1546 large shipments of silver become the fabled source of wealth. During the 16th century, Spain hold the equivalent of US$ 1.5 trillion( 1990 terms) in gold and silver from New Spain. Being the most powerful European monarch at a time full of war and religious conflicts, the Habsburg rulers spend the wealth in wars and arts across Europe. `` I learn a proverb here'', say a French traveler in 1603: `` Everything be dear in Spain except silver''.[ 163] The spent silver, suddenly spread throughout a previously cash-starved Europe, cause widespread inflation.[ 164] The inflation be worsen by a grow population with a static production level, low salaries and a rise cost of living, which damage local industry. Increasingly, Spain become dependent on the revenues flow in from the mercantile empire in the Americas, lead to Spain's first bankruptcy in 1557 due to rise military costs.[ 165] Phillip II of Spain default on debt payments in 1557, 1560, 1575 and 1596. The increase in prices as a result of currency circulation fuel the growth of the commercial middle class in Europe, the bourgeoisie, which come to influence the politics and culture of many countries.

Ronald Coase( 1910–2013) of the Chicago School of Economics be the most prominent economic analyst of law, and the 1991 Nobel Prize in Economics winner. His first major article The Nature of the Firm( 1937) argue that the reason for the existence of firms( companies, partnerships, etc.) be the existence of transaction costs. Homo economicus trades through bilateral contracts on open markets until the costs of transactions make the use of corporations to produce things more cost-effective. His second major article The Problem of Social Cost( 1960) argue that if we live in a world without transaction costs, people would bargain with one another to create the same allocation of resources, regardless of the way a court might rule in property disputes. Coase use the example of an old legal case about nuisance name Sturges v Bridgman, where a noisy sweets maker and a quiet doctor be neighbors and go to court to see who should have to move.[ 93] Coase say that regardless of whether the judge rule that the sweets maker have to stop use his machinery, or that the doctor have to put up with it, they could strike a mutually beneficial bargain about who move house that reach the same outcome of resource distribution. Only the existence of transaction costs may prevent this.[ 94] So the law ought to preempt what would happen, and be guide by the most efficient solution. The idea be that law and regulation be not as important or effective at help people as lawyers and government planners believe.[ 95] Coase and others like him want a change of approach, to put the burden of proof for positive effects on a government that be intervene in the market, by analyze the costs of action.[ 96]
In Ban Chiang, Thailand (Southeast Asia), bronze artifacts have been discovered dating to 2100 BCE.

Hellenic infighting leave Greek city states vulnerable, and Philip II of Macedon unite the Greek city states under his control. The son of Philip II, know as Alexander the Great, invade neighboring Persia, topple and incorporate its domains, as well as invade Egypt and go as far off as India, increase contact with people and cultures in these regions that mark the beginning of the Hellenistic period.

It be probable that the first musical instrument be the human voice itself, which can make a vast array of sounds, from sing, hum and whistle through to click, cough and yawn. In 2008 archaeologists discover a bone flute in the Hohle Fels cave near Ulm, Germany.[ 7][ 8][ 9] The five-holed flute have a V-shaped mouthpiece and be make from a vulture wing bone. The oldest know wooden pipes be discover near Greystones, Ireland, in 2004. A wood-lined pit contain a group of six flutes make from yew wood, between 30 and 50 cm long, taper at one end, but without any finger holes. They may once have be strap together.[ 10]

In paleolithic times, mostly animals were painted, in theory ones that were used as food or represented strength, such as the rhinoceros or large cats (as in the Chauvet Cave). Signs such as dots were sometimes drawn. Rare human representations include handprints and half-human/half-animal figures. The Cave of Chauvet in the Ardèche département, France, contains the most important cave paintings of the paleolithic era,[citation needed] dating from about 36,000 BCE.[70][71] The Altamira cave paintings in Spain were done 14,000 to 12,000 BCE and show, among others, bisons. The hall of bulls in Lascaux, Dordogne, France, dates from about 15,000 to 10,000 BCE.

The Kushan Empire expanded out of what is now Afghanistan into the northwest of the subcontinent under the leadership of their first emperor, Kujula Kadphises, about the middle of the 1st century CE. They came of an Indo-European language speaking Central Asian tribe called the Yuezhi,[157][158] a branch of which was known as the Kushans. By the time of his grandson, Kanishka the Great, the empire spread to encompass much of Afghanistan,[159] and then the northern parts of the Indian subcontinent at least as far as Saketa and Sarnath near Varanasi (Benares).[160]

A first attempt to explore western South America was undertaken in 1522 by Pascual de Andagoya. Native South Americans told him about a gold-rich territory on a river called Pirú. Having reached San Juan River (Colombia), Andagoya fell ill and returned to Panama, where he spread news about "Pirú" as the legendary El Dorado. These, along with the accounts of success of Hernán Cortés, caught the attention of Pizarro.
This article details the history of electrical engineering.

The first known landing in Australia by Europeans was by Dutch navigator Willem Janszoon in 1606. Twenty-nine other Dutch navigators explored the western and southern coasts in the 17th century, and dubbed the continent New Holland.[34] Macassan trepangers visited Australia's northern coasts after 1720, possibly earlier.[35][36] Other European explorers followed until navigator Lieutenant James Cook claimed the east coast of Australia for Britain in 1770, without conducting negotiations with the existing inhabitants.[37] He returned with accounts favouring colonisation at Botany Bay (now in Sydney), New South Wales.

The history of agriculture records the domestication of plants and animals and the development and dissemination of techniques for raising them productively. Agriculture began independently in different parts of the globe, and included a diverse range of taxa. At least 11 separate regions of the Old and New World were involved as independent centers of origin.

Although North Africa was influenced to a certain extent by European Bronze Age cultures (for example, traces of the Bell beaker tradition are found in Morocco[dubious – discuss][citation needed]), it has long been believed that Africa did not have its own metallurgy traditions until the Phoenician colonization (ca. 1100 BC) of North Africa, and that it remained attached to the Neolithic way of life[dubious – discuss][citation needed]. The civilization of Ancient Egypt, whose influence did not extensively cover Africa outside of the Nile's reach, was believed to be the sole exception to this rule as regards the whole range of ancient cultures of Africa. Recently, however, some discoveries have been made that appear to contradict these views.[citation needed]

In 1999, Australia lead a United Nations force into East Timor to help establish democracy and independence for that nation, follow political violence.[ 417] During this period Australia commit to a number of other peacekeeping and stabilisation operations: notably in Bougainville, include Operation Bel Isi( 1998–2003); as well as Operation Helpem Fren and the Australian-led Regional Assistance Mission to Solomon Islands( RAMSI) in the early 2000s; and the 2006 East Timorese crisis.[ 418]

As an alternative form of medicine in India, Unani medicine get deep roots and royal patronage during medieval times. It progress during Indian sultanate and mughal periods. Unani medicine be very close to Ayurveda. Both be base on theory of the presence of the elements( in Unani, they be consider to be fire, water, earth and air) in the human body. According to followers of Unani medicine, these elements be present in different fluids and their balance lead to health and their imbalance lead to illness.[ 19]

Though positivist approaches remain important in geography, critical geography arose as a critique of positivism. The first strain of critical geography to emerge was humanistic geography. Drawing on the philosophies of existentialism and phenomenology, humanistic geographers (such as Yi-Fu Tuan) focused on people's sense of, and relationship with, places. More influential was Marxist geography, which applied the social theories of Karl Marx and his followers to geographic phenomena. David Harvey and Richard Peet are well-known Marxist geographers. Feminist geography is, as the name suggests, the use of ideas from feminism in geographic contexts. The most recent strain of critical geography is postmodernist geography, which employs the ideas of postmodernist and poststructuralist theorists to explore the social construction of spatial relations.

Stone tools were made from a variety of stones. For example, flint and chert were shaped (or chipped) for use as cutting tools and weapons, while basalt and sandstone were used for ground stone tools, such as quern-stones. Wood, bone, shell, antler (deer) and other materials were widely used, as well. During the most recent part of the period, sediments (such as clay) were used to make pottery. Agriculture was developed and certain animals were domesticated as well.
Vespasian sent legions to defend the eastern frontier in Cappadocia, extended the occupation in Britain and reformed the tax system. He died in 79 AD.

Renaissance theatre derived from several medieval theatre traditions, such as, the mystery plays that formed a part of religious festivals in England and other parts of Europe during the Middle Ages. Other sources include the "morality plays" and the "University drama" that attempted to recreate Athenian tragedy. The Italian tradition of Commedia dell'arte, as well as the elaborate masques frequently presented at court, also contributed to the shaping of public theatre.

Galileo Galilei has been called the "father of modern observational astronomy",[42] the "father of modern physics",[43][44] the "father of science",[44][45] and "the Father of Modern Science".[46] His original contributions to the science of motion were made through an innovative combination of experiment and mathematics.[47]

In 1485 Ivan III commission the building of the royal residence, Terem Palace, within the Kremlin, with Aloisio da Milano as the architect of the first three floors. He and other Italian architects also contribute to the construction of the Kremlin walls and towers. The small banquet hall of the Russian Tsars, call the Palace of Facets because of its facetted upper story, be the work of two Italians, Marco Ruffo and Pietro Solario, and show a more Italian style. In 1505, an Italian know in Russia as Aleviz Novyi or Aleviz Fryazin arrive in Moscow. He may have be the Venetian sculptor, Alevisio Lamberti da Montagne. He build 12 churches for Ivan III, include the Cathedral of the Archangel, a building remarkable for the successful blending of Russian tradition, Orthodox requirements and Renaissance style. It be believe that the Cathedral of the Metropolitan Peter in Vysokopetrovsky Monastery, another work of Aleviz Novyi, later serve as an inspiration for the so-called octagon-on-tetragon architectural form in the Moscow Baroque of the late 17th century.

Philological studies flourished during the Qing Dynasty, with Duan Yucai and Wang Niansun as the towering figures. The last great philologist of the era was Zhang Binglin, who also helped lay the foundation of modern Chinese linguistics. The Western comparative method was brought into China by Bernard Karlgren, the first scholar to reconstruct Middle Chinese and Old Chinese with Latin alphabet (not IPA). Important modern Chinese linguists include Y. R. Chao, Luo Changpei, Li Fanggui and Wang Li.

In 1627 the south coast of Australia be accidentally discover by François Thijssen and name't Land van Pieter Nuyts, in honour of the highest ranking passenger, Pieter Nuyts, extraordinary Councillor of India,[ 85] In 1628 a squadron of Dutch ships be send by the Governor-General of the Dutch East Indies Pieter de Carpentier to explore the northern coast. These ships make extensive examinations, particularly in the Gulf of Carpentaria, name in honour of de Carpentier.[ 84]

In 1511–1512, Portuguese captains João de Lisboa and Estevão de Fróis reach the River Plate estuary in present-day Uruguay and Argentina, and go as far south as the present-day Gulf of San Matias at 42°S( record in the Newen Zeytung auss Pressilandt mean `` New Tidings from the Land of Brazil'').[ 82][ 83] The expedition reach a cape extend north to south which they call Cape of `` Santa Maria''( Punta del Este, keep the name the Cape nearby); and after 40°S they find a `` Cape'' or `` a point or place extend into the sea'', and a `` Gulf''( in June and July). After they have navigate for nearly 300 km( 186 mi) to round the cape, they again sight the continent on the other side, and steer towards the northwest, but a storm prevent them from make any headway. Driven away by the Tramontane or north wind, they retrace their course. Also give the first news of the White King and the `` people of the mountains'' to the interior( the Inca Empire), and a gift, an ax of silver, obtain from the Charrúa natives on their return( `` to the coast or side of Brazil''), and `` to West''( along the coast and the River Plate estuary), and offer to King Manuel I.[ 84] Christopher de Haro, a Flemish of Sephardic origin( one of the financiers of the expedition along with D. Nuno Manuel), who would serve the Spanish Crown after 1516, believe that the navigators have discover a southern strait to west and Asia.

Jacksonville be especially important to the African American film industry. One notable individual in this regard be the European American producer Richard Norman, who create a string of films star black actors in the vein of Oscar Micheaux and the Lincoln Motion Picture Company. In contrast to the degrading parts offer in certain white films such as The Birth of a Nation, Norman and his contemporaries seek to create positive stories feature African Americans in what he term `` splendidly assume different roles.''

Newton had also specifically attributed the inherent power of inertia to matter, against the mechanist thesis that matter has no inherent powers. But whereas Newton vehemently denied gravity was an inherent power of matter, his collaborator Roger Cotes made gravity also an inherent power of matter, as set out in his famous preface to the Principia's 1713 second edition which he edited, and contradicted Newton himself. And it was Cotes's interpretation of gravity rather than Newton's that came to be accepted.
Applied innovation extend to commerce. At the end of the 15th century Luca Pacioli publish the first work on bookkeeping, make him the founder of accounting.[ 66]

The military campaigns of Alexander the Great spread Greek think to Egypt, Asia Minor, Persia, up to the Indus River. The result Hellenistic civilization produce seats of learn in Alexandria in Egypt and Antioch in Syria along with Greek speaking populations across several monarchies. Hellenistic science differ from Greek science in at least two ways: first, it benefit from the cross-fertilization of Greek ideas with those that have develop in the larger Hellenistic world; secondly, to some extent, it be support by royal patrons in the kingdoms found by Alexander's successors. Especially important to Hellenistic science be the city of Alexandria in Egypt, which become a major center of scientific research in the 3rd century BC. Two institutions establish there during the reigns of Ptolemy I Soter( reign 323–283 BC) and Ptolemy II Philadelphus( reign 281–246 BC) be the Library and the Museum. Unlike Plato's Academy and Aristotle's Lyceum, these institutions be officially support by the Ptolemies; although the extent of patronage could be precarious, depend on the policies of the current ruler.[ 21]

Wallis identifies a prestige hierarchy with university educated physicians on top, followed by learned surgeons; craft-trained surgeons; barber surgeons; itinerant specialists such as dentist and oculists; empirics; and midwives.[54]

Some economists, such as Robert E. Lucas, Jr., say that the real impact of the Industrial Revolution be that `` for the first time in history, the living standards of the masses of ordinary people have begin to undergo sustained growth ... Nothing remotely like this economic behaviour be mention by the classical economists, even as a theoretical possibility. ``[ 4] Others, however, argue that while growth of the economy's overall productive powers be unprecedented during the Industrial Revolution, living standards for the majority of the population do not grow meaningfully until the late 19th and 20th centuries, and that in many ways workers' living standards decline under early capitalism: for instance, studies have show that real wages in Britain only increase 15% between the 1780s and 1850s, and that life expectancy in Britain do not begin to dramatically increase until the 1870s.[ 5][ 6]

Franz Boas establish academic anthropology in the United States in opposition to this sort of evolutionary perspective. His approach be empirical, skeptical of overgeneralizations, and eschew attempts to establish universal laws. For example, Boas study immigrant children to demonstrate that biological race be not immutable, and that human conduct and behavior result from nurture, rather than nature.

Aristarchus of Samos publish work on how to determine the sizes and distances of the Sun and the Moon, and Eratosthenes use this work to figure the size of the Earth. Hipparchus later discover the precession of the Earth.

The Ming dynasty was founded by Zhu Yuanzhang in 1368, who proclaimed himself as the Hongwu Emperor. The capital was initially set at Nanjing, and was later moved to Beijing from Yongle Emperor's reign onward.

The "Tuʻi Tonga Empire" or "Tongan Empire" in Oceania are descriptions sometimes given to Tongan expansionism and projected hegemony dating back to 950 AD, but at its peak during the period 1200–1500. While modern researchers and cultural experts attest to widespread Tongan influence and evidences of transoceanic trade and exchange of material and non-material cultural artifacts, empirical evidence of a true political empire ruled for any length of time by successive rulers is lacking.[15]

Austerity be another response, the policy of reduce government budget deficits. Governor Macquarie's wife, Elizabeth Macquarie took an interest in convict women's welfare.[154] Her contemporary Elizabeth Macarthur was noted for her 'feminine strength' in assisting the establishment of the Australian merino wool industry during her husband John Macarthur's enforced absence from the colony following the Rum Rebellion.[155] The Catholic Sisters of Charity arrived in 1838 and set about pastoral care in a women's prison, visiting hospitals and schools and establishing employment for convict women.[156] The sisters went on to establish hospitals in four of the eastern states, beginning with St Vincent's Hospital, Sydney in 1857 as a free hospital for all people, but especially for the poor.[157] Caroline Chisholm (1808–1877) established a migrant women's shelter and worked for women's welfare in the colonies in the 1840s. Her humanitarian efforts later won her fame in England and great influence in achieving support for families in the colony.[158] Sydney's first Catholic Bishop, John Bede Polding founded an Australian order of nuns—the Sisters of the Good Samaritan—in 1857 to work in education and social work.[159] The Sisters of St Joseph, were founded in South Australia by Saint Mary MacKillop and Fr Julian Tenison Woods in 1867.[160][161][162] MacKillop travelled throughout Australasia and established schools, convents and charitable institutions. One misconception, first propagated in the 19th century[329] and still very common, is that all people in the Middle Ages believed that the Earth was flat.[329] This is untrue, as lecturers in the medieval universities commonly argued that evidence showed the Earth was a sphere.[330] Lindberg and Ronald Numbers, another scholar of the period, state that there "was scarcely a Christian scholar of the Middle Ages who did not acknowledge [Earth's] sphericity and even know its approximate circumference".[331] Other misconceptions such as "the Church prohibited autopsies and dissections during the Middle Ages", "the rise of Christianity killed off ancient science", or "the medieval Christian church suppressed the growth of natural philosophy", are all cited by Numbers as examples of widely popular myths that still pass as historical truth, although they are not supported by current historical research.[332]

Neo-expressionism was a style of modern painting that became popular in the late 1970s and dominated the art market until the mid-1980s. It developed in Europe as a reaction against the conceptual and minimalistic art of the 1960s and 1970s. Neo-expressionists returned to portraying recognizable objects, such as the human body (although sometimes in a virtually abstract manner), in a rough and violently emotional way using vivid colours and banal colour harmonies. The veteran painters Philip Guston, Frank Auerbach, Leon Kossoff, Gerhard Richter, A. R. Penck and Georg Baselitz, along with slightly younger artists like Anselm Kiefer, Eric Fischl, Susan Rothenberg, Francesco Clemente, Jean-Michel Basquiat, Julian Schnabel, Keith Haring, and many others became known for working in this intense expressionist vein of painting.

Merchant Francis Cabot Lowell from Newburyport, Massachusetts memorised the design of textile machines on his tour of British factories in 1810. Realising that the War of 1812 had ruined his import business but that a demand for domestic finished cloth was emerging in America, on his return to the United States, he set up the Boston Manufacturing Company. Lowell and his partners built America's second cotton-to-cloth textile mill at Waltham, Massachusetts, second to the Beverly Cotton Manufactory. After his death in 1817, his associates built America's first planned factory town, which they named after him. This enterprise was capitalised in a public stock offering, one of the first uses of it in the United States. Lowell, Massachusetts, using 5.6 miles (9.0 km) of canals and 10,000 horsepower delivered by the Merrimack River, is considered by some as a major contributor to the success of the American Industrial Revolution. The short-lived utopia-like Waltham-Lowell system was formed, as a direct response to the poor working conditions in Britain. However, by 1850, especially following the Irish Potato Famine, the system had been replaced by poor immigrant labour.

The Dahomey Kingdom was founded in the early 17th century when the Aja people of the Allada kingdom moved northward and settled among the Fon. They began to assert their power a few years later. In so doing they established the Kingdom of Dahomey, with its capital at Agbome. King Houegbadja (c. 1645–1685) organized Dahomey into a powerful centralized state. He declared all lands to be owned of the king and subject to taxation. Primogeniture in the kingship was established, neutralizing all input from village chiefs. A "cult of kingship" was established. A captive slave would be sacrificed annually to honor the royal ancestors. During the 1720s, the slave-trading states of Whydah and Allada were taken, giving Dahomey direct access to the slave coast and trade with Europeans. King Agadja (1708–1740) attempted to end the slave trade by keeping the slaves on plantations producing palm oil, but the European profits on slaves and Dahomey's dependency on firearms were too great. In 1730, under king Agaja, Dahomey was conquered by the Oyo Empire, and Dahomey had to pay tribute. Taxes on slaves were mostly paid in cowrie shells. During the 19th century, palm oil was the main trading commodity.[186] France conquered Dahomey during the Second Franco-Dahomean War (1892–1894) and established a colonial government there. Most of the troops who fought against Dahomey were native Africans.[citation needed]

The Hephthalites( or Ephthalites), also know as the White Huns, be a nomadic confederation in Central Asia during the late antiquity period. The White Huns establish themselves in modern-day Afghanistan by the first half of the 5th century. Led by the Hun military leader Toramana, they overrun the northern region of Pakistan and North India. Toramana's son Mihirakula, a Saivite Hindu, move up to near Pataliputra to the east and Gwalior to the central India. Hiuen Tsiang narrate Mihirakula's merciless persecution of Buddhists and destruction of monasteries, though the description be dispute as far as the authenticity be concern.[ 191] The Huns be defeat by the Indian kings Yasodharman of Malwa and Narasimhagupta in the 6th century. Some of them be drive out of India and others be assimilate in the Indian society.[ 192]

It is important to note that ancient precedent existed for alternative theories and developments which prefigured later discoveries in the area of physics and mechanics; but in light of the limited number of works to survive translation in a period when many books were lost to warfare, such developments remained obscure for centuries and are traditionally held to have had little effect on the re-discovery of such phenomena; whereas the invention of the printing press made the wide dissemination of such incremental advances of knowledge commonplace. Meanwhile, however, significant progress in geometry, mathematics, and astronomy was made in medieval times, particularly in the Islamic world as well as Europe.

Once women were allowed in Antarctica, they still had to fight against sexism and sexual harassment.[96][97] However, a tipping point was reached in the mid 1990s when it became the new normal that women were part of Antarctic life.[98] Women began to see a change as more and more women began working and researching in Antarctica.[99]

Great Zimbabwe is the largest medieval city in sub-Saharan Africa. By the late nineteenth century, most buildings reflected the fashionable European eclecticism and pastisched Mediterranean, or even Northern European, styles.

The word "Renaissance" is borrowed from the French language, where it means "re-birth". It was first used in the eighteenth century and was later popularized by French historian Jules Michelet (1798–1874) in his 1855 work, Histoire de France (History of France).[78][79]

Apart from some scattered reference in ancient and medieval records, rest on slender evidence and in need of interpretation, the earliest clearly verifiable human flight take place in Paris in 1783, when Jean-François Pilâtre de Rozier and François Laurent d'Arlandes go 5 miles( 8.0 km) in a hot air balloon invent by the Montgolfier brothers. The Wright brothers make the first sustain, control and power heavier-than-air flight on December 17, 1903, in their revolutionary aircraft, the Wright Flyer.
In Central Europe, the 17th century scientist and educator John Amos Comenius promulgate a reformed system of universal education that be widely use in Europe.

In Eastern Europe, Byzantium revived its fortunes under Emperor Basil I (r. 867–886) and his successors Leo VI (r. 886–912) and Constantine VII (r. 913–959), members of the Macedonian dynasty. Commerce revived and the emperors oversaw the extension of a uniform administration to all the provinces. The military was reorganised, which allowed the emperors John I (r. 969–976) and Basil II (r. 976–1025) to expand the frontiers of the empire on all fronts. The imperial court was the centre of a revival of classical learning, a process known as the Macedonian Renaissance. Writers such as John Geometres (fl. early 10th century) composed new hymns, poems, and other works.[130] Missionary efforts by both eastern and western clergy resulted in the conversion of the Moravians, Bulgars, Bohemians, Poles, Magyars, and Slavic inhabitants of the Kievan Rus'. These conversions contributed to the founding of political states in the lands of those peoples—the states of Moravia, Bulgaria, Bohemia, Poland, Hungary, and the Kievan Rus'.[131] Bulgaria, which was founded around 680, at its height reached from Budapest to the Black Sea and from the Dnieper River in modern Ukraine to the Adriatic Sea.[132] By 1018, the last Bulgarian nobles had surrendered to the Byzantine Empire.[133]

Most of the subcontinent be conquer by the Maurya Empire during the 4th and 3rd centuries BCE. From the 3rd century BCE onwards Prakrit and Pali literature in the north and the Sangam literature in southern India start to flourish.[ 11][ 12] Wootz steel originate in south India in the 3rd century BCE and be export to foreign countries.[ 13][ 14][ 15] Various parts of India be rule by numerous dynasties for the next 1,500 years, among which the Gupta Empire stand out. This period, witness a Hindu religious and intellectual resurgence, be know as the classical or `` Golden Age of India''. During this period, aspects of Indian civilisation, administration, culture, and religion( Hinduism and Buddhism) spread to much of Asia, while kingdoms in southern India have maritime business links with the Middle East and the Mediterranean. Indian cultural influence spread over many parts of Southeast Asia which lead to the establishment of Indianised kingdoms in Southeast Asia( Greater India).[ 16][ 17]

Ancient architecture be characterize by this tension between the divine and mortal world. Cities would mark a contain sacred space over the wilderness of nature outside, and the temple or palace continue this order by act as a house for the gods. The architect, be he priest or king, be not the sole important figure; he be merely part of a continue tradition.[ citation need]

Aristotle's inductive-deductive method use inductions from observations to infer general principles, deductions from those principles to check against further observations, and more cycles of induction and deduction to continue the advance of knowledge[ 14]

In Classical Antiquity, the inquiry into the workings of the universe took place both in investigations aimed at such practical goals as establishing a reliable calendar or determining how to cure a variety of illnesses and in those abstract investigations known as natural philosophy. The ancient people who are considered the first scientists may have thought of themselves as natural philosophers, as practitioners of a skilled profession (for example, physicians), or as followers of a religious tradition (for example, temple healers).

Overall, from about 1910, American films have the largest share of the market in all European countries except France, and even in France, the American films have just push the local production out of first place on the eve of World War I. So even if the war have not happen, American films may have become dominant worldwide. Although the war make things much worse for European producers, the technical qualities of American films make them increasingly attractive to audiences everywhere.

The numbers of British in India be small, yet they be able to rule two-thirds of the subcontinent directly and exercise considerable leverage over the princely state that account for the remain one-third of the area.

World War II saw a drastic increase in the pace of aircraft development and production. All countries involved in the war stepped up development and production of aircraft and flight-based weapon delivery systems, such as the first long-range bomber.

Music and theatre scholars study the history and anthropology of Semitic and early Judeo-Christian culture, have also discover common links between theatrical and musical activity in the classical cultures of the Hebrews with those of the later cultures of the Greeks and Romans. The common area of performance be find in a `` social phenomenon call litany,'' a form of prayer consisting of a series of invocations or supplications. The Journal of Religion and Theatre notes that among the earliest forms of litany, `` Hebrew litany be accompany by a rich musical tradition:''[ 14]

The ancient Egyptians cultivate emmer and barley, and several other cereal grains, all of which be use to make the two main food staples of bread and beer.[ 104] Flax plants, uproot before they start flower, be grow for the fibers of their stems. These fibers be split along their length and spun into thread, which be use to weave sheets of linen and to make clothing. Papyrus grow on the banks of the Nile River be use to make paper. Vegetables and fruits be grow in garden plots, close to habitations and on higher ground, and have to be water by hand. Vegetables include leeks, garlic, melons, squashes, pulses, lettuce, and other crops, in addition to grapes that be make into wine.[ 105]

The Renaissance began in times of religious turmoil. The late Middle Ages was a period of political intrigue surrounding the Papacy, culminating in the Western Schism, in which three men simultaneously claimed to be true Bishop of Rome.[67] While the schism was resolved by the Council of Constance (1414), a resulting reform movement known as Conciliarism sought to limit the power of the pope. Although the papacy eventually emerged supreme in ecclesiastical matters by the Fifth Council of the Lateran (1511), it was dogged by continued accusations of corruption, most famously in the person of Pope Alexander VI, who was accused variously of simony, nepotism and fathering four children (most of whom were married off, presumably for the consolidation of power) while a cardinal.[68]

Much later in the Roman period, Pliny the Elder produce a very extensive discussion of many more minerals and metals then widely use for practical ends. He be among the first to correctly identify the origin of amber as a fossilized resin from trees by the observation of insects trap within some pieces. He also lay the basis of crystallography by recognise the octahedral habit of diamond.
In the 12th and 13th centuries, Central Asian Turks invaded parts of northern India and established the Delhi Sultanate in the former Hindu holdings.[275]

Witelo is considered a precursor of perception psychology. His Perspectiva contains much material in psychology, outlining views that are close to modern notions on the association of ideas and on the subconscious.

The basic construction form be more or less similar to Eastern Asian building system. From a technical point of view, buildings be structure vertically and horizontally. A construction usually rise from a stone subfoundation to a curve roof cover with tiles, hold by a console structure and support on posts; walls be make of earth( adobe) or be sometimes totally composed of movable wooden doors. Architecture be build accord to the k'an unit, the distance between two posts( about 3.7 meters), and be design so that there be always a transitional space between the `` inside'' and the `` outside.''

During the Second World War( 1939–1945), India be control by the United Kingdom, with the British holding territories in India include over five hundred autonomous Princely States; British India officially declare war on Nazi Germany in September 1939.[ 378] The British Raj, as part of the Allied Nations, send over two and a half million volunteer soldiers to fight under British command against the Axis powers. Additionally, several Indian Princely States provide large donations to support the Allied campaign during the War. India also provide the base for American operations in support of China in the China Burma India Theatre.

One of the more colorful figures in 20th-century mathematics be Srinivasa Aiyangar Ramanujan( 1887–1920), an Indian autodidact who conjecture or prove over 3000 theorems, include properties of highly composite numbers, the partition function and its asymptotics, and mock theta functions. He also make major investigations in the areas of gamma functions, modular forms, divergent series, hypergeometric series and prime number theory.

De Stijl be also the name of a journal that be publish by the Dutch painter, designer, writer, and critic Theo van Doesburg propagate the group's theories. Next to van Doesburg, the group's principal members be the painters Piet Mondrian, Vilmos Huszár, and Bart van der Leck, and the architects Gerrit Rietveld, Robert van't Hoff, and J.J.P. Oud. The artistic philosophy that form a basis for the group's work be know as neoplasticism — the new plastic art( or Nieuwe Beelding in Dutch).

In the early part of the last century, a parallel concept called Unit Processes was used to classify reactive processes. Thus oxidations, reductions, alkylations, etc. formed separate unit processes and were studied as such. This was natural considering the close affinity of chemical engineering to industrial chemistry at its inception. Gradually however, the subject of chemical reaction engineering has largely replaced the unit process concept. This subject looks at the entire body of chemical reactions as having a personality of its own, independent of the particular chemical species or chemical bonds involved. The latter does contribute to this personality in no small measure, but to design and operate chemical reactors, a knowledge of characteristics such as rate behaviour, thermodynamics, single or multiphase nature, etc. are more important. The emergence of chemical reaction engineering as a discipline truly signaled the severance of the umbilical cord connecting chemical engineering to industrial chemistry, and served to cement the truly unique character of this discipline.

To enforce a trade monopoly, Muscat, and Hormuz in the Persian Gulf, be seize by Afonso de Albuquerque in 1507, and in 1507 and 1515, respectively. He also enter into diplomatic relations with Persia. In 1513 while try to conquer Aden, an expedition lead by Albuquerque cruise the Red Sea inside the Bab al-Mandab, and shelter at Kamaran island. In 1521, a force under António Correia conquer Bahrain, usher in a period of almost eighty years of Portuguese rule of the Gulf archipelago.[ 91] In the Red Sea, Massawa be the most northerly point frequent by the Portuguese until 1541, when a fleet under Estevão da Gama penetrate as far as Suez.

From the 5th century, Western Europe be plunge into a period of general disorder that last( with a brief period of stability under the Carolingian Empire in the 9th century) until the 10th century. As such, most organized theatrical activities disappear in Western Europe. While it seem that small nomadic bands travel around Europe throughout the period, perform wherever they could find an audience, there be no evidence that they produce anything but crude scenes.[ 33] These performers be denounce by the Church during the Dark Ages as they be view as dangerous and pagan.

The British, the French, and the Soviets departed from many parts of the Middle East during and after World War II. Iran, Turkey, Saudi Arabia, and the Middle East states on the Arabian Peninsula generally remained unaffected by World War II. However, after the war, the following Middle East states had independence restored or became independent:
